characters: IN A SERIES OF FADE-TO-BLACKS, THE FOLLOWING IMAGES
FINAL BOARDING CALL FOR NEW YORK
WITHOUT SAYING THIS NEEDS THE RIGHT PIECE OF MUSIC
OH FUCK, OH FUCK, THAT HUUUURTS

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: 1   OPENING CREDIT SEQUENCE. Images and sounds are surrea dreamlike, disturbing: A HAND is trying to dial three simple numbers. Trembling fingers miss, try again...we hear boop-boop-boop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) 911 operator, what is your emergency?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rises, gripped tightly. Knuckles white. We're T it's dark, we see no face -- just slack, trembling lips. Whoever it is, he can't talk. All we hear is breathing, a we sense is grief and panic and deep shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) Hello? Can you hear me? Can you speak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Can you speak up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...her...eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights appear like phantoms over blacktop, flashing. Poli cars coming our way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, what is the nature of your emergency?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man can't speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir? Are you injured? Do you need medical attention?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cars blast by us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...her eyes...she can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICE VEHICLES converge in SLOW-MOTION, dreamlike. Doors open, COPS jump out, weapons drawn as WE MOVE with them t Front door. RAMP TO NORMAL CAMERA SPEED as it opens, reve BENSON CLYDE, phone still gripped. He barely registers th weapons aimed at his face. CAMERA CLOSES IN ON HIM, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't...close her eyes. He's pulled from frame. CAMERA KEEPS MOVING, following CO into the house... Dark as hell inside. And tense. Arms training weapons. Mo up a tight hallway, emerging into...

dialogues.speaker: THE LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: ...where the flashlight beams find blood-spatter patterns Furniture shattered and overturned. A kid's sneaker. The flashlights play across TWO BODIES in the wreckage -- woman's pale hand, a child's motionless leg. CAMERA DRIFTS AROUND to the cops' faces, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unsnaps shoulder radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dispatch, we have multiple 10-55s, need full response, 11-41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaotic now, vehicles and lights. The eye of the storm is Clyde on the lawn, hugging his knees, fetal with horror a grief. He's screaming at the sky, but no sound is coming EMS TECHS enter shot, steal the frame, race toward the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING SHOT at floor level, photos being taken. FLASHES bathe the foreground wreckage. FORENSIC TECHS step ginger Uniformed cops hang grimly back, hugging the walls... CAMERA BRINGS US TO CLOSEUP: A PROFILE IN DEEP SHADOW in foreground, face tilted obliquely in the wreckage. A CAMERA FLASH reveals the face with shocking glare and t IMAGE FREEZES. A TEN YEAR-OLD GIRL, eyes open, staring at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (prelap)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes. That's how they were. Open like that. You see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde is seated, speaking slowly and precisely. ANGLE WID revealing the room, light filtering through blinds, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I found my wife and child dead, my little girl's eyes were open. (pause) The last thing she saw of this earth were the faces of the men who took her life. Can you understand that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes, I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you? Really? (looks to somebody else) You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Clyde. I don't see this helping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? You married? Children?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE HAS NOW WIDENED/DRIFTED to include D.A. JONAS CANTR Senior Attorney for the State. He wears thick glasses and suffering the early stages of macular degeneration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divorced. I have a son and daughter. Both in college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daughter was ten. I married late in life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde spreads the crime scene photos further on the table ANGLE COMES AROUND to reveal the third man in the room:

dialogues.speaker: NICK PRICE
dialogues.text: The D.A. under Cantrell -- focused, exceptional at what h does, the man you'd want on your side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, Mr. Price? Married? Kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick doesn't answer, stays focused on the task:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen the crime scene photos, Mr. Clyde. Many times. They're horrifying. But they don't alter the facts of the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Facts? Those men are guilty. Both of them. You know they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't about what we know. It's about what we can prove in court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things have gone against us. Tainted crime scene, evidence thrown out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you just haven't tried hard                     * enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. We've had only one real break in this case. The fact that one asshole has decided to testify against the other asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In return for immunity. So he gets away with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other man doesn't. He'll go down for the crime. That has to count for something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It counts for half. (pause, quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't reward one of the men who murdered my family. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Clyde. I can't claim to know what it's like to be in your position. Losing your wife and child. But please try to grasp how limited our options are. This is how the justice system works. Clyde sits for a long moment, numb, absorbing this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. I see my mistake. I came for justice. Instead I got a system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH LOWELL, fresh out of law school, is waiting anxious for the meeting to end, arms full of file folders.

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: With her is BILL REYNOLDS, the defense attorney in this c glancing impatiently at his watch. Clyde exits the room fast, not watching where he's going, accidentally plowing into Sarah as he passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. My fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. On he goes. Nick and Cantrell exit the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're due upstairs in three minutes! You're gonna be late!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, voice of doom. They move toward the elevators with Reynolds. Sarah's at heels, sensing the tension and keeping her mouth shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cantrell)                                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We doing the right thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumps in)                                       *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You even doubt it? C'mon, you didn't just tumble off the fucking truck. Do the math... Cantrell has trouble seeing the elevator button, misses. presses it for him. (This is thrown away without comment; both men are used to Cantrell's bad eyes by now.) They elevator opens, they get on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and ride up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your decision. Nick shoots him a withering look, glances back at Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you asking her for? She's                      * just an intern.                                         *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deer in the headlights)                         *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am just an intern.                                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were top of your class at Yale, don't give me that shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young lady. Someday you might have our jobs. You know the issues of                      * the case before the court. Speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Um. You can take both men to trial, spend a year and millions of taxpayer dollars, and probably lose. Or you can cut a deal and at least put one of the men who did the crime on death row. It's a no-brainer.                      * You make the deal.                                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smug, to the men)                            * Duh.                                                  *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They trade a look. Cantrell glances to Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the day comes that you argue a real case in court, you might refrain from summing up with "duh."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll avoid that.                                      *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUDGE LAURA BURCH presides. Nick, Cantrell, Sarah are pre CLARENCE DARBY is the focus, Bill Reynolds at his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agreement has been vetted by both sides? Satisfactory to all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, your Honor. Defense approves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: State also approves, your Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick places a document before DARBY, along with a pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarence Darby. This document guarantees that you will provide testimony against Rupert Ames in the matter of which you were both accused. In return, you will be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shielded from further prosecution for those capital crimes. But you will plead guilty to the lesser charge of breaking and entering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll do a maximum of five years. With good behavior, you could be out in three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That also depends on your testimony and the level of your cooperation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor need not worry on my account. I assure the court that I am aware of the opportunity I've been given. And I am deeply grateful to all concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick gives Cantrell a glance, both stoically enduring thi proceeding. Darby pulls the document closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I may. It has come to my attention that Rupert Ames has been spreading                   * lies about me to the tabloid press.                   * About certain alleged activities of                   * which I have no knowledge. Sexual and otherwise. Libel and slander...yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dryly) You can always sue him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no matter. My tongue will wag in court, under oath. His tongue will wag in hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts pen to paper, looks to Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll get the chair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't do chair. We do needle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cathedral-like, pigeons fluttering. The door from the hal opens and BETSY, a months-old GERMAN SHEPHERD PUPPY, boun toward us on a leash pulling Cantrell toward the top of t vast marble staircase. Nick trails them, nervous as hell:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, Jonas, take my elbow.                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not blind. Yet. I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're shitty on stairs. At least let me take the leash so the dog doesn't pull you down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She needs to imprint on me. Not you, not somebody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cantrell starts down. Nick's at his side, hovering and re to grab him, jumping at every little lurch Cantrell makes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the whole point of this phase. She needs to get the idea that she and I are partners. Then the real training can begin. Unless you wanna lead me around the rest of my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Cantrell emerge into daylight and find Darby in protective custody of a FEDERAL MARSHAL on the courthouse steps, surrounded by a crush of REPORTERS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...it was a burglary gone wrong. We thought the house was empty. Rupert found the woman and child at home and went crazy. I was stoned and in fear of my own life, so I fled...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They catch sight of Bill Reynolds, the defense attorney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill! You let all your clients give testimony on the courthouse steps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellooo, kettle to pot. Since when do you shy away from publicity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since everything in this case has gone sideways so far. Tell your boy to save it for the courtroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's your boy too now. You tell him. Reynolds proceeds down the steps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dickwad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckface. ...and vanishes in the crowd. Nick glances sourly toward

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and may I say for the record how very sorry I am that I failed to prevent Rupert Ames from committing those terrible crimes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You good here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long as nobody bumps into me. CAMERA FOLLOWS Nick through the crowd toward Darby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...been given a chance to put the drugs and foul living behind me. To atone for my past failings and weakness of character. It is a gift given me by God's grace... Darby sees Nick, grabs his hand, shaking it for the camer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the grace and wisdom of this court. I cannot thank you enough, sir. I cannot. A BARRAGE OF CAMERA FLASHES. Nick caught off guard before press, Darby not letting go. Then Nick sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde, a tiny defeated figure far below, waits at the bus stop. He's gazing up, seeing this photo op happen.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: breaks the handshake with a flush of discomfort, signals federal marshal:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshal, escort your man, please! (to the reporters) Mr. Darby is done here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darby is hustled down the steps. The reporters surge to N surrounding him, shouting questions. Nick looks over their heads and glimpses Clyde getting on bus. The door closes, the bus pulls away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick enters. Dark. He drops his briefcase by the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REFLECTED IN THE MIRROR: KELL, Nick's wife, is just out o the bath, wearing a robe and toweling her hair. Nick enters behind her. She cranes back for a kiss, keeps toweling her hair in the mirror. He hugs her from behind, buries his face in her neck. Drained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit day. Better now. (pause) How's she doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. She drove me a little crazy today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was busy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In overdrive. Here. Feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches around, slowly unties her robe, pulls it open. ...revealing her pregnant belly. (Our angles have avoided this till now.) He places his hand, feeling for movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course she stops kicking the moment you get home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLOW TRACKING SHOT finds them in bed, Nick with his head Kell's chest. Pensive.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE
dialogues.text: NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to say some things to a man today I didn't want to say. And I did something I didn't want to do. KELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't lie to him. Or bullshit him. Or shine him on. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of those things. KELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you had your reasons. You did what you had to. It's not your fault the world sucks. Nick smiles, eases his face to her belly. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You in there. Listen up. Your mother just said the world sucks. You may wanna rethink this whole thing. My advice? If you're asking? Just stay in there. I promise you, nothing will ever make as much sense as it does right now... KELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is wrong with you? NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...plus there's shit you don't need to know about. Rap. Internet porn. Madonna's entire back catalog. KELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did someone drop you on your head? Seriously. I have swollen ankles and all I do is pee. That baby's coming out. NICK (weighs that)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'm sure you heard that. Then again there are the Beatles. 70's funk. Louie. Ella. Be a shame to miss those. (beat, getting serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, kid. Bring it on. But when you're old enough for the world to disappoint you, I hope you won't blame your old man for bringing you into this mess. Give me that at least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Kell asleep. She's no longer pregnant -- it's no ten years later. A long beat of quiet... A small face peers in from the hallway. EMMA, their 10 ye old daughter. She darts in, puts her face to Nick's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? Wha--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hollering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She jumps up on the bed, bouncing up and down and dancing around, hollering at the top of her lungs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Kell are too groggy to do anything but ride it o Emma sails off the bed and vanishes out the door, holleri all the way up the hallway:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Kell are left groping with blankets, heart rates and consciousness:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad it's once a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Emma finishing breakfast, getting ready to leave Kell packing Emma's lunch at the counter:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't you be here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a work thing. Grownup stuff. You know that happens sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's... (draws sneakily close)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He claps his hand over her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe we've established that. I let go, you'll stop reminding me? (she nods, he lets go) We'll celebrate this weekend. Tonight is all about your friends. Knock                    * yourselves out, don't give mom any                  * grief. I'll try to be home in time to tuck you in, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. But what are you doing tonight that is more important than...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's doing that "sneakily drawing close" thing again. Ni holds up his finger, cautioning her to say it quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leans in, whispers) ...my birthdaaaaay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something he'd get out of if he could. Here. Take lunch. Grab                       * backpack. We go.                                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma grabs her stuff, kisses dad, races from the room. Ke grabs her keys to follow, kisses Nick goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice evasion. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars are traveling an old service road...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's in back with Cantrell. The years have left Cantrel 90% blind; his glasses are beyond Coke bottle-thick.

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: Between them sits Betsy the German shepherd, now ten year old, wearing a guide-dog harness. She looks miserable wea a big cone-shaped POST-SURGERY COLLAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long she have to wear this stupid thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Till the stitches heal. Week or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick dotes on the dog, they're old pals:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor honey. Sucks, doesn't it? But you're very pretty. Yes, you are. Even with a radar dish on your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There they are. Like clockwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE SHIFTS TO Sarah -- much more confident and power-su than last time we saw her -- riding up front with the dri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car pulls up to the gate as CAMERA RISES to reveal th new facility positioned right next to the old one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The condemned, RUPERT AMES, is placed against the upright execution table and buckled in. The table is tilted back vertical. All Rupert can do is lay there and watch, as: MEDICAL TECHS swab his arms with alcohol, prepare the nee find his veins. The needles are inserted, taped off. The lines are attached. Very methodical. The techs leave the room. The curtain is drawn aside, rev the big window that separates the chamber from:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and his colleagues are among SEVERAL DOZEN WITNESSES seated in chairs. They watch as WARDEN IGER faces Rupert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rupert Ames. Do you have anything to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rupert doesn't have much of an IQ and he's scared shitles but he does his best:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here. Clarence Darby ain't. And that ain't right. 'Cause that man is evil, ain't no other way to say it. All them things he done, and him turn witness against me for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses, trying to untangle his thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did wrong too. I guess I'll pay up. But it was always him sayin' jump and how high, and I just went along. Now he's killin' me and he got you people to do it. And that's a shame. A goddamn shame. And... (pause) ...and I guess that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick trades a look with Sarah. Cantrell is stoic. Warden Iger nods to TWO GUARDS manning the LETHAL INJECTI MACHINE, on which EIGHT OVERSIZED GLASS CYLINDERS in a ve row are the main feature, filled with various clear liqui There are two switches -- one a dummy, the other live (no to know which is which). The guards power up the machine. Lights activate on the board. Each man grabs a switch, wa Nick watches the wall clock. It hits 7 o'clock. The warde nods and the guards flick their switches, quickly leaving room. The warden follows them out, closes the door. We hear the pumps quietly activate. Rupert is taking shal breaths, terrified...then lays back to wait. PLUNGER ONE slowly descends, emptying its contents into t I.V. lines... Rupert sags as the fast-acting barbiturate spreads throug his veins...his breathing slows...his head drops back... loses consciousness... PLUNGER TWO depresses, sending the second vial of liquid the I.V. lines with a quiet whir of pumps...

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: PLUNGER THREE activates...then PLUNGER FOUR...the row of cylinders emptying in sequence... Rupert lies unconscious, just drifting away... He suddenly comes to. He draws in a long, shaky breath. I catches in his throat. His eyes go wide. His entire body to clench against some increasing pain. Nick is surprised, uncertain. Betsy starts GROWLING SOFTL Cantrell's side. Her head comes up, hackles rising. Nick glances to the dog...then to Iger, sees the stunned on the warden's face. Something is definitely wrong. The pumps keep whirring, the plungers keep descending... Rupert he throws his head back, mouth wide...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah...ah...AH! The witnesses go tense, confused -- what the hell? RUPERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah--ah--Jesus, don't that HURT! Rupert looks down at his arms, his expression turning to horror, because: The veins are turning angry red, then blackening, as the liquids course through them... RUPERT

dialogues.speaker: OH FUCK, OH FUCK, THAT HUUUURTS
dialogues.text: Those are last coherent words he speaks. From then on, he just shrieking and bouncing against his straps, because: His veins are starting to smoke. Noxious and foul. The fl starts giving away, blood eating though skin like acid. Shock sweeps the onlookers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus. CANTRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on? Nick? People are on their feet. Horror and incomprehension. CANTRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, goddamn it, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! Rupert is fast becoming a horror:

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: It's going down his arms and legs, up his neck, infusing ears -- a nauseating discoloration courses through his bo using his veins as a road map, going from red to yellow t black like bruises birthing spontaneously before our eyes People in the room scream, turning away. Nick pushes his to the viewing glass, shouting at the techs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The techs dash into the chamber -- but are instantly gagg and choking on the toxic fumes billowing from Rupert. The retreat coughing, pulling the door shut again. Rupert's screams spew forth toxic fumes...breath blows sm from his nostrils...eyes liquefy...he's arching against h restraints so hard that bones begin snapping, blood spewi and smoking through his skin... All Nick can do is stand at the glass in horror as whatev is happening runs its course and the victim collapses in cloudy, toxic haze...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drained and waiting: Nick sitting against the town car. Cantrell across from him with Betsy at his side (the guid dog will always be at his side in this movie, specified o not). EMERGENCY LIGHTS are swirling all around them. A PARADE OF PEOPLE descends: DETECTIVE DUNNIGAN, Sarah, W Iger, COPS, PRISON STAFF. Intense:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're still trying to sort through this thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, we face a terrible shitstorm of scrutiny in the days to come. We need answers. Start with what we know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lethal injection is a series of drugs given in a specific order. Somebody had to have replaced one or more of those ingredients with something else. (off their looks) Industrial solvent? Acid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not guess, let forensics do its job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could the chemicals be switched? We're in a goddamn prison!                           *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll ask because somebody has to.                    * Is there any chance, no matter how remote, that this was an accident? A mix-up? Weird shit happens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat of awkward silence. The warden hesitating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show them. The bad part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunnigan brings our group in. ELECTRICIANS huddle at an a of circuits and trunk lines. In the dancing flashlight be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some kind of bypass on the phone                     * lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick sees a CIRCUIT-BOARD spliced into the wiring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty minutes before the execution,                 * the prison stopped receiving incoming calls and emails. Cell service went                  * dark too. Signal was probably jammed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bad part. I was just on with the Governor's office. He commuted Rupert Ames' sentence. They were trying to call us to stop the execution. They couldn't get through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Cantrell are stunned as this sinks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Governor's incoming number triggered this device and shut out any further calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cantrell removes his glasses, rubs his eyes. Softly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck me. Fuck me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more thing.                                       *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunnigan aims his maglight and swings the junction box co all the way open. Scrawled on the inside of the door in r are the words: "HIS TONGUE WILL WAG IN HELL."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This mean anything to you?                            *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PUSHES IN on Nick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's LAPTOP sits on an unmarked car, streaming the D.A. DATABASE by wireless. Nick taps the keys, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarence Darby. That's what he said when he agreed to testify against the man we executed tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "His tongue will wag in hell." Those very words? It was ten years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember it too. Some things stick in your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check the court transcripts, they're public record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DARBY'S MUGSHOT (ten years ago) scans up, along with pert info of that time. GARZA, Dunnigan's partner, peers at it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this prick. I'm pretty sure                    * he's one of our C.I.s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprised looks are traded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think, or you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the name he uses now.                    * But I'm pretty sure he's one of Bernstein's informants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, raise Bernstein, I want everything he's got, including an address. We roll with tactical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about I ride-along? Give you a fast, accurate ID on this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that necessary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said yourself we should move fast. This thing'll be all over the morning news cycle. We'd all look a lot better if we have the right man in custody by then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Cantrell's look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AERIAL SHOT: ANGLING DOWN to find a CONVOY OF POLICE VEHI speeding across a bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garza driving. Dunnigan riding shotgun. Nick in back, put on a tactical vest. A transmission comes over the car's dashboard computer: a MURKY NIGHTTIME SHOT OF A MAN in sunglasses and Hawaiian shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him. "Wayne Dunlap."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that Clarence Darby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so. Hard to tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunnigan scrolls the classified police data pertaining to informant: dates, number of convictions attributed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, look at this. No wonder Bernstein loves him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We scored a lot of good intel off this fuckhead through the years. Almost a shame to bag the guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A snort from Nick. The cops glance back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shame?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's helped us put a lot of bad people behind bars. Look. Arrests, convictions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can read a C.I. profile. What I see is an asshole dirty up to his ears in the drug trade. So you cops look the other way? He gets a free pass as long as he keeps feeding you convictions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that what you did ten years ago? Give this guy a free pass in return for a conviction? (off Nick's look) Maybe we played this asshole to our advantage on the street, but you're the one who put him there. So, no offense, but you might wanna go fuck yourself a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stares at the man on the dashboard computer screen..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...who is indeed Clarence Darby, naked and drenched with taking a hit off a crack pipe. A woman's HAND flails up i frame, trying to grab for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait...wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sucks in a full breath, hands the pipe off to: LISA, t thin tattooed skank he's got bent over his bed and is fuc from behind. She flares the bowl with a lighter, barely registering any reaction as he keeps pumping her.

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: DARBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost. Almost. LISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This shit makes you soft, baby. DARBY (thrusting, grimacing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you...for stating the obvious...you...bitch... He grits his teeth. Screams. Finishes. He sags, catching breath, and glances at the PLASMA TV SCREEN, which has be playing silently. He grabs the remote, unmutes the set: NEWSCASTER (V.O.)                   *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...rumors the execution did not go well due to technical flaws, but that has yet to be confirmed... DARBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Did not go well." Way to go, Rupert. You even fucked up dying. LISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that guy? DARBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knew. Past tense. CELL PHONE RINGS, he answers. VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne? DARBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends. Who's this? VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody who doesn't want to see you in jail. Look out your window. (Darby hesitates)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Argue later. Do it now. Darby goes to the window. Headlights in the distance. Lot them. He grabs binoculars off the sill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All cop. Racing this way. No lights, no sirens.

dialogues.speaker: DARBY
dialogues.text: lowers the binoculars, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a world of shit coming your way. I'd get out the back. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Click -- line dead. Darby frozen for a moment, looking ar at all the drugs and paraphernalia. He scrambles, tossing his pants, grabbing his shirt. Lisa jumps off the bed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to the window, sees cars sweeping from the darkn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are those fucking cops?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darby lunges to a bookcase, grabs a REVOLVER from behind books, sails out the bedroom door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and races down the steps with Lisa at his heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't leaving me here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She catches him halfway across the room, holding him back smashes the gun into her face repeatedly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and knocks her bleeding and crying to the floor. He sa on through the kitchen, leaving her there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and bursts through the screen door, fleeing barefoot a the back yard as VEHICLES AND COPS swarm the front of the house. A cruiser nails him with a spotlight:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over car speakers) You! Freeze right there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darby, never slowing, swings his arm around, FIRING his revolver blindly at all the lights...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...whoa, fuck, gunshots! Cops scramble and dive.   Nick h just gotten out of Dunnigan's car -- a cruiser's   window a blind hit nearby, exploding glass. Nick ducks,   total out of his element. Drawing, Dunnigan throws him   to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darby runs like an amped-up rat in a maze, hearing cop ca in the night: Engines ROARING, tires SQUEALING... Suddenly, the SOUND OF A HELICOPTER above. Darby dashes f cover against a garage, lost in shadow. A massively brigh searchlight sweeps from above, probing... Darby crouches, heart hammering, watching the searchlight scan over rooftops. His phone RINGS, he answers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ditch the gun. Wipe the prints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard six shots. Revolver? Bring extra ammo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darby glances at the gun, realizing. He bangs his head ba against the garage wall in frustration -- fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shot at cops. That's attempted murder if they find the gun on you. You're in deep enough without that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darby frantically wipes the gun with his shirttail, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll need my help getting out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'll it cost me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll discuss terms later. Go south, across 10th. Past the El tracks. Alley behind the clinic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cop. Take his ride, he won't give                    * you any trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause I tasered his ass. You gonna keep asking questions?

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: Click -- line dead. Darby breaks cover, heaves the gun in somebody's yard, keeps moving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaotic with cops and lights. Lisa is dragged out, shriek and bleeding, her face a broken mess. ANGLE TO Nick watch it all unfold. He sees Dunnigan approach:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way he's getting out of this neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darby finds a POLICE CRUISER parked in the moonlight, win down. Dark inside. A LOCAL COP is sprawled across the fro seat...groaning, coming to. Darby jumps in, passenger side, wrestles the cop upright. yanks the cop's service revolver, slapping him awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darby reaches over and keys the engine to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drive, fucker! I'll put your brains on the dash!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disoriented) Don't shoot! Don't hurt me, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends on you. Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop hits the gas. Tense moments go by as they acceler up a dark road. Darby ducks as COP CARS stream past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunnigan and Nick tense, hearing a VOICE over the radio:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heavily filtered) ...air unit three...see no sign of suspect...think we lost him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keys mic) Keep sweeping the area, unit three. (to Tactical Commander) Go house-to-house. Check everything.                  * Garages, dumpsters, storm drains...                   *

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: NICK                                  *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be kidding me.                            * Dunnigan -- angry, at a loss -- doesn't reply. Cops are scrambling in all directions. Nick turns, steps TOWARD CAMERA INTO A TIGHT SHOT, gazing into the darkness. Something very weird just happened her but he has no idea what. Softly: NICK                                  *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could we lose him?                              *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracks and factories, remote and deserted. Far away, the COPTER is still buzzing, searching... The police cruiser appears, stops. Darby emerges with gun flashlight leveled, motions for the cop to get out. The c complies with hands raised, shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the ditch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...please...don't kill me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knees. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darby shoves him stumbling into the ditch. The cop sinks his knees and starts to weep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never see my wife and little girl again. I'll never see them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darby steps closer, draws the hammer back, takes aim for head shot...but his PHONE RINGS. He pulls it fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This my guardian angel? (beat) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On his knees in the muck, the cop's quiet weeping becomes soft laughter. He brings up a cell phone, speaks into it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you got out okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darby draws back, confused, gun still aimed. The cop snap his cell phone shut, rises to face him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why I'll never see my wife and daughter again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes his hat off, peels his moustache away. Darby pin him with the flashlight, finally and fully revealing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took them from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recognition floods Darby. He pulls the trigger, and:

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: Nothing. Just a click, Darby freezing, a hiss of pain. No comprehending. Clyde reaches for the gun, pries open Darby's fingers, pu it from his grasp... revealing the TINY NEEDLES that spra from the pistol's grip into Darby's palm. Darby stares at his perforated palm. His knees give out a Clyde catches him, eases him to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE: A head encased in a hood. The hood is pulled off, revealing Darby -- eyes wide, lying on a rough table. Ben Clyde leans over him, checks his pupils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't speak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He displays the prop gun rigged with the needles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tetrototoxin. Fascinating stuff. It paralyzes you, but leaves all other neurological functions intact.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE
dialogues.text: He sets the gun down, starts rooting through some instrum that Darby can't see (though he's straining to). CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That means you can't move. Or talk. But you can see. Hear. Feel. (busying himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That last one's important. Feel. You can feel everything. (glances at bottled drugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got some other items here. Drugs to revive you in case you pass out. Stuff like that. Darby almost manages to speak, thrashing weakly. Clyde le over, checks his pupils again. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing off a little. No worries. He tucks a padded block under Darby's head like a pillow, raising his head so he can see better. Clyde moves down t table, tightens straps holding Darby down. But the worst TOURNIQUETS are tied on Darby's arms and legs at various points. Darby sees them and starts hyperventilating. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. These. Don't want you bleeding out. This will take a while. Clyde puts on a thick coat, like a meat-packer's. He retu sorting implements, Darby trying to see. Clyde obliges hi holding things up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pliers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teeth. (hacksaw)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balls. (bolt cutter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fingers. Maybe toes. (scalpel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyelids. In case you insist on shutting your eyes. Darby's screaming -- but with the tetrototoxin in his sys all that's coming out is air, like a slow leak. Clyde picks up an object, unfolds it -- a full-body plast coat. He puts it on over his other coat, as: CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earlier on the phone? I said I'd get you out? You asked me what it would cost? Well.

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: He finishes buttoning up, crosses back to the table, rais new object into view: a CIRCULAR POWER SAW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll start with an arm and a leg. Go from there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. The reality of what he's about to do washing over

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been waiting to say that line                    * for years. But it wasn't very funny, was it? No. Played much better in my head. Maybe it's my delivery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts a construction-site face protector atop his head, kind with a full plastic face shield that can be flipped He turns and undoes the slipknot of a laundry cord stretc up to the ceiling. He feeds the cord and a full-length mi tilts down horizontally above the table. Darby finds hims staring straight up into it -- he'll see everything.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND VIDEO CAMERA
dialogues.text: The CAMERA'S LCD SCREEN looms large in our shot. The LCD dark, the camera inactive. It's mounted high on a tripod, aimed down at the table. Clyde approaches b.g., pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gosh. My heart's beating. You?                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flips his visor down -- dark, no face visible. He reac up, turns the camera on. The LCD screen activates. ANGLE CLOSES IN until all we see is: THE LCD IMAGE. Grainy in low light. Clyde, now faceless b the visor, crosses to the squirming figure on the table. hear the CIRCULAR SAW BUILD TO A HIGH SHRIEK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the SHRIEKING SAW FADES... 40   HOLD IN BLACK. THE BLACKNESS OPENS UP -- we're in a cop car's trunk look up as the lid is opened. A FIGURE in a meat-packing coat over us, faceless and scary behind a dark face protector.

dialogues.speaker: TRUNK
dialogues.text: reveals OFFICER HILTS hand-cuffed and duct-taped. He's sp the night in here. He recoils, terrified and blinded by g

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: The figure opens a wicked-sharp butterfly knife, CLICK-CL it open. He leans down, slits the tape binding Hilts' arm drops the keys in the cop's hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police cruiser sits on a dirt road, a FEMALE DISPATCH VOICE issuing softly and incessantly from the radio:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...unit twenty one, come in...unit twenty one, please respond...report your location...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mysterious figure strides from the police cruiser to MIDNIGHT BLUE 1965 LINCOLN CONTINENTAL in superb conditio shrugging off his thick coat. He gets in, hits the gas. Hilts struggles to uncuff himself in the cruiser's trunk, arms and legs cramping, as: The Lincoln becomes a CLOUD OF DUST receding in the dista

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cleaning up the aftermath of the party: Nick up on a step stool taking down the birthday banner; Kell in her robe f the dishwasher; Emma zooming in and out shuttling paper p and plastic cups into a big trash bag...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and while we were singing karaoke, Ashley was all dancing around and jumping up and down and suddenly she gets this look on her face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw it coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and suddenly she just went barf. Total puke moment. And we were all like, ewwww gross! It was so funny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's out of the kitchen to grab more stuff. Kell starts preparing a bowl of cereal for Emma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny for her. I cleaned it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had my "ewwww gross" moment last night too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I had a house full of shrieking ten year-old girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I saw a guy's veins dissolve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey. It's not a competition. (off his look) Okay, you win.

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: Emma re-enters, dumping more trash:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...so Tara says that's what you get for eating too much cake and that almost made Ashley puke again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOORBELL RINGS. Kell glances out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delivery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabs her cereal) I'll get it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs out. Nick comes off the step-stool, gratefully a a cup of coffee from Kell. He suddenly freezes, notices: The kitchen TV is playing CNN: a top-of-the-hour story on Rupert Ames execution and foul-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit. We've gone national.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the front door, a MESSENGER hands Emma a GIFT BASKET trailing mylar balloons with "Happy Birthday Emma" on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes the door, turns toward us, finds a CARDBOARD ENVELOPE on the basket -- a card? She opens it, finds: Not a card. An unlabeled DVD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOCAL SHERIFFS (not city cops) are spreading out across t fields, beating the grass, looking for clues... ANGLE TO Officer Hilts, blanket-draped and still rattled his night-long ordeal, being interviewed by a SERGEANT:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the suspect who tasered you last                    * night...was it the same person who                     * let you out of the trunk this morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never saw a face...either time...he wore a thing, a face shield...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, we hear a DISTANT VOICE shouting in panic:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant! Sergeant!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody's gaze snaps up, tense. Across the fields, a YO COP is stumbling away from a distant farm shed, pointing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come quick! You gotta see this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick at the table with Kell, riveted to CNN: STATE OFFICI including Iger, are being grilled in a media frenzy. Cant was right, it's a shitstorm of scrutiny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma, munching her bowl of breakfast cereal, slots the DV the player. She backs up, hits play with the remote. An IMAGE appears on screen, grainy. Emma looks perplexed. It's not a normal DVD -- more like a bad home movie: A figure in a plastic coat and face shield turns from the camera to a table, where another man is strapped down. The first man raises a circular saw. The man on the table thrashing weakly, trying to move. Emma still has no idea she's looking at. Suddenly: The man with the saw makes a quick sweep across the table across the other man's leg at the shin. The move was so f and casual that it's taking a moment to sink in: Emma stands frozen, clutching her cereal bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B.G., we see Nick lean back in his chair, reacting to her tone of voice...and by what sounds like a shrieking saw. On screen, the man with the saw picks up the severed limb shows it to the victim. It's been lopped off below the kn Emma drops her bowl -- it shatters at her feet. Nick and enter behind her, confused, not sure what they're seeing. On screen, the man with the saw lops off the victim's for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma turns, throws herself into her parents' arms. They d to their knees, shielding their sobbing daughter. PUSH IN them staring at the shrieking saw...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is this? Jesus Christ, Nick! Turn it off! Turn it off! (comforting Emma) It's okay, baby, I'm here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick lunges to turn off the TV as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door is swung open in a blaze of sunlight. The local enter with pistols drawn and shotguns leveled. Faces go s with horror as their eyes adjust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my Lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RECORD is pulled from a sleeve. An old-school vinyl LP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops easing in. ANGLE SWINGS QUEASILY AROUND as they ente WIDENING to reveal a scene of nightmare intensity: Blood everywhere. Streaks. Spatters. And body parts. Strewn and discarded. Intestines nailed to the rafters overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RECORD PLAYER NEEDLE DROPS, hits the groove with a HISS vinyl. MUSIC STARTS TO PLAY LOUDLY, BOOMING through the s FOCUS REMAINS WITH the spinning record. An OUT-OF-FOCUS F in a rolling chair pushes away from the record player and sails across the room toward a brightly-lit work table...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops are covering their mouths with handkerchiefs, gaggin The stench is incredible. Flies are buzzing and swarming. cop turns away and doubles over, trying not to puke. The Sergeant moves cautiously forward, finds: A HEAD. On wooden dissection table. Clarence Darby, not that you'd recognize him. His eyes are gone. His lips are missing. H teeth...well, most of them are scattered about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MINIATURE CIVIL WAR SOLDIER is held in extreme magnific before us under a tabletop magnifier, the tip of a paintb delicately evoking stunning detail...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma is still sobbing into her mother's arms as Nick take the frame f.g., shouting into the phone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daughter is traumatized! She's                      * only ten! It's a goddamn snuff film!                   * In my home!                                            *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (motioning O.S.) Price got a video of it happening delivered to his house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunnigan enters frame f.g., snatches up his extension. He listens for a few beats, trying to get a word in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we know. Nick, we know. The body's been found. The pieces, anyway. Call just came in. (beat) In some old shed on a farm outside                     * the city. About a hundred and fifty acre piece of property.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belonging to who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GIANT EYEBALL stares at us, unnaturally magnified by a tabletop magnifier. The lens is swept aside, revealing: Benson Clyde. In addition to the tabletop magnifier, he's wearing MAGNIFYING LENSES on his head. He examines the fi with his naked eye, then flips the glasses down to contin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VEHICLES race along two-lane blacktop: CRUISERS, UNMARKED CARS, TACTICAL VANS. A POLICE HELICOPTER skims along just above them at scary-low altitude... The cars veer off pavement and up a dirt road, kicking up awesome trail of dust as the copter sweeps wide, pacing..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tense faces: Dunnigan, Garza, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde pauses, hearing a RUMBLE under the music. Glances u the rumble passes overhead -- a helicopter? He clicks on tiny fan, holds the figurine under it, giving it a final

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shitstorm descends: vehicles swerving in, COPS jumping machine gun-toting SWAT TACTICAL TROOPS pouring from vans

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde, still holding the figurine under the whirring fan, leans to one side in his chair, glancing out the window. He glimpses scurrying figures behind cars, cops darting a surrounding the house, motioning with hand signals... He holds up the figurine for a final look. Satisfied with he places it onto: A CHESSBOARD -- the last piece. All the others are also h painted, gorgeous. Real craftsmanship here. He stands. Calmly moves to the middle of the room. Kicks his shoes. Peels off his shirt and undershirt. Even takes his pants. There will be no confusion about hidden weapon He positions himself, very precise and purposeful. Lifts hands high above his head. Presenting himself. Waiting. Then, bam: doors EXPLODE in and windows SHATTER as the SW tactical troops storm the room, bad-asses in black, machi guns aimed, encircling him, everybody shouting:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde is the calm eye of a pissed-off storm of highly professional cops with itchy trigger fingers. He remains serene, looking around at them, hands raised high...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He compliantly goes to his knees, then prone, offers his behind his back. They move in, cuff him, as troops spread throughout the house yelling "Clear!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, wearing his kevlar, follows Dunnigan and Garza. Nic glances over and sees a perfect 1965 midnight-blue Lincol Continental in the carport...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde is pulled to his feet just as Nick enters. UNIFORMS spread out, securing the house. Dunnigan faces Clyde...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benson Clyde. You have the right to remain silent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as the full Miranda is read, Nick and Clyde have their eyes locked throughout -- this moment is all about them..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...understand your rights as I have explained them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde is hustled outside, leaving Nick with Dunnigan and in the farmhouse -- it's renovated, clean, very loft-like Nick drifts to the table, sees the chess board, can't hel admiring the pieces. Then his eyes go to a floor-to-ceili bookcase. He's stunned to realize: they're all law books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check this shit out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick turns, moves to Garza's side. Dunnigan joins them. A three staring at a wall. ANGLE SHIFTS around to reveal: The long-ago PHOTO (clipped from a newspaper) of Nick and Clarence Darby shaking hands on the courthouse steps. ANGLE WIDENS to reveal: Photo after photo. The crime scene photos...photos of Cly and his family in happier times...photos clipped from mag and newspapers about the murder and trial...all very neat and precisely arrayed. The entire wall covered with them. THE MUSIC KEEPS BOOMING from the record player. Dunnigan TIGHT TO CAMERA and yells:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde sits alone and isolated in a small room. WIDEN to r Sarah at the observation glass. She turns as Nick steps u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says he'll only talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE
dialogues.text: Nick and Dunnigan prepare to go in. Dunnigan takes off hi gun and holster, lays them on a table, as Garza activates VIDEO. Cantrell finds a chair by feel, sits down, as:

dialogues.speaker: INNER ROOM
dialogues.text: Nick and Dunnigan enter. Dunnigan melts into a corner to observe as Nick sits across the table from Clyde. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Counselor. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Clyde. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why so formal? We go way back. Call me Benson. Or Ben. Nick sits across the table from Clyde, settles in. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. I'm here. So? CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. Maybe you can explain what this is all about. Nick almost laughs -- not what he expected to hear. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's obvious. Clyde spreads his hands questioningly -- not really. DUNNIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You murdered two people. Rupert Ames and Clarence Darby. CLYDE (shifts his gaze)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective...? DUNNIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunnigan. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunnigan. I thought I'd made it clear I would only speak to the gentleman across the table from me. Dunnigan glowers at him, looks to Nick. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You murdered two people. Rupert Ames and Clarence Darby. BLUE   -     9-19-08                                  38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darby? I knew about Ames, of course. I've been following the news about his horribly botched execution. But Darby too? Quite a coincidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut the shit. We know you did it. Save everybody a lot of time and trouble and just confess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to continue to insist on being part of this conversation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, gives in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Far be it from me to be rude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarence Darby was found on your property. Old abandoned shed?                *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know I had one. It's 150 acres, uncultivated. The other day I found a creek I never knew I had. Hunters trespass all the time. You going to try to pin the dead deer on me too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That man is frosty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It occurs to me that an even moderately clever person could try to frame me for the murder simply by killing him on my property. One of Darby's drug rivals? That's an unsavory world. (off Nick's stare)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A jury would have to weigh that possibility. What else you got?

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: NICK (temper flaring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about video of you dismembering Darby while he was still alive? CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's odd. See, if I were to do such a thing, I'd probably wear something so I couldn't be identified. Some kind of mask maybe. But you say it's actually me on the video? Did the camera capture my good side?                                          * Nick snaps, lunges across the table, grabs Clyde. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sick fuck, you sent it to my house! My daughter saw that video! It fucking traumatized her! She couldn't stop sobbing! Dunnigan moves in fast, trying to pull Nick off (but fail DUNNIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa-whoa, Nick, ease off! CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No trouble here, Detective, we're fine. Thank you, though. Dunnigan backs off. Clyde turns back to Nick, who's still him in his grasp, their faces close. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your daughter is, what, ten now? That's a wonderful age. My daughter was always so busy at that age, so interested, so into everything. Jumping around. I called her "Bean," she jumped around so much. Nick is easing off by inches, subtly and ineffably weirde out, unable to break Clyde's gaze. Softly: CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am sorry, Nick, that your daughter experienced that. You're right. That video should not have arrived that way. The person who sent it should have thought twice. Dunnigan moves in again, gently but firmly pulls Nick awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, enough. WHITE   -   9-7-8                                   40. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless there's hard evidence tying me to these crimes -- forensic or otherwise -- why am I here? Why are we having this conversation? NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know you did it. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not about what you know. It's about what you can prove in court. (off Nick's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your words. Like when you called it a justice system. You know the thing about a system, Nick? Any system can be played. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you can play us? You gonna take me on? CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarence Darby did. And I'm much smarter than he was. Or you. Nick advances, furious, held back by Dunnigan: NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna bury you, fucker! CLYDE (lunges to his feet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, that's what I want! That fire in the belly! That's what I wanted ten years ago! Do it, Nick! Bury me! DUNNIGAN (shouting at Clyde)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down! Sit the fuck down! Clyde does, settles in, speaking calmly: CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or. Set me free. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I stutter? Make your case. Or. Shake my hand on the courthouse steps and send me on my way. (off Nick's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll even make it easy on you. I will confess, how's that? BLUE   -   9-19-08                                  41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna confess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's start tomorrow after a good night's sleep. We'll all be fresh and rested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick paces agitated, with the group:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten years he's been planning this?             * Patient people make me nervous. This? This freaks me out.                      *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he serious about confessing?                * What's his deal, is he crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confession or not, we're gonna nail him on two counts of first-degree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agreed, but softly. Nothing hard- ass, no grand-standing. Kid gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid gloves? He's a psycho with a power saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depending on who's writing the headline, he's a grieving husband and father who got revenge on the men who murdered his wife and child. (off Nick's look) Public sympathy is to be respected and feared. This could blow up in our faces if we're not careful. We can't look like we're pissed off or have an ax to grind. (stops) Are we pissed off? Do we have an ax to grind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then stop acting like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Nick takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. He got under my skin a little. That's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEADICAM TWO SILHOUETTES: We're following Nick and Sarah through one of the pedestrian tunnels to the street:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...background check's gotta be thorough, I want to know everything there is to know about this son of a bitch. Get all the ADAs on it, tell 'em I better not see them sitting around on their asses or texting their pals...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about outside help? That P.I. who helped us on the Jacovitz case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he was good. And Hanson's                        * always reliable. But try to limit their hours, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We find a MERCEDES at the curb -- Kell at the wheel, Emma back. Nick gets in. Sarah leans down, happy to see them. face lights up -- the little girl obviously adores her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hello there beauty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Kell! Hey Emma, how's my dynamo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Sarah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't seen you in so long it's ridiculous. When are you gonna come by for a visit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who needs a life, right? Talk to your husband, maybe he'll give us a day off one of these years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon, huh? Seriously, we miss you.

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: Sarah blows Emma a big extravagant kiss. Emma returns it, waves as they pull away. Nick and Kell glance back, happy see their daughter acting a bit more like her old self...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late. Nick, in t-shirt and pajama bottoms, comes up a dar hallway with a file in his hand, rubbing his eyes. He com to his daughter's bedroom door, quietly turns the knob...

dialogues.speaker: EMMA'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: ...and finds the bed empty. Sheets thrown back. Nick stands for a moment, every irrational fear he's ever washing over him. CAMERA FOLLOWS HIM fast down the hallwa ...into the master bedroom, where he finds Emma sleeping Kell. He stands for a moment, heart hammering. Softly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kell stirs, sees him, puts a finger to her lips. In whisp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw her bed empty. Scared the shit out of me. Don't know why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had a bad dream. She wanted to sleep with us tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feels his heart race) Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stirs) Daddy...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He climbs onto the bed, cuddles up, Emma between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a nightmare. That man.                         *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Shhh. We're all good. You're safe. Nobody's gonna hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Especially not that man. Daddy's gonna put him in jail forever. That's what daddy does. He makes sure the bad people stay locked away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick lays there, listening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge domed chamber. In the center of the floor stands a smaller free-standing domed cage, like a bizarre birdcage Inside the birdcage: Nick and Garza wait. Garza mans a ca Outside the birdcage: Observers. Some (Cantrell and Sarah occupy floor-level, where the video monitors are. Others and Dunnigan) are on a catwalk above that encircles the r A door opens and Clyde is brought into the birdcage. He g around, checking his surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I admit I expected something more modern. That jail downtown?                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filled to capacity. It has been for years. They had to re-open this for the overflow. Part of it anyway.                   *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the county jail annex.                  * All new inmates come here. It was                  * in the papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Prison crowding. It's a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits. Nick joins him, pulls out a legal pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the record: You've waived legal counsel. You've offered to confess to the murders of Clarence Darby and Rupert Ames. Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get to that. First, what I'd really like to talk about is the cot in my cell. It's lumpy. (off Nick's stare) Hardly any padding? Steel springs? Very uncomfortable?

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what lumpy means. Sorry to hear it. But we're not here to talk about prison conditions, we're here to talk about things you've done. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start with things I haven't done. Like get any sleep last night. (beat, leans forward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said let's begin today fresh and                * rested. You recall my words?                      * NICK                                *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want from me? CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bed in my cell. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bed. In your cell. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, please. One of those Sleep- Matic adjustables. Those are best.                * NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want the variable temperature control too? CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be nice. Beat. Nick tosses his legal pad on the table, swivels aro in his chair to the observers up on the catwalk, spreads arms in a "help me" gesture. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody? DUNNIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a steel cot! It's bolted to                  * the wall!                                         * BLUE   -   9-19-08                                   46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure they have a wrench.                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We also have rules prohibiting                  * personal items such as beds.                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks to Nick) Let me get this straight. You're going to let a bed prevent this confession from taking place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You looking to deal? All right, how's this? How about I don't kick your fucking teeth down your throat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde is mildly taken aback. The cops tense up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Jonas. Okay, kid gloves. (to Clyde) My daughter slept in our bed last night. She hasn't done that since she was six. You gave her nightmares. So excuse me if I don't feel like cutting any little deals today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daughter can't have nightmares, because she died with Clarence                  * Darby's breath in her face. You                 * gave him a reduced sentence and his             * freedom. All I want is a good night's sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody's wound up, talking fast:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is bullshit. He's jerking our chain big-time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can justify the expense.                      *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not just a bed. Every inmate               * here will be on the phone to their              * lawyer filing lawsuits for equal treatment. Can you justify that?                *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offering) We give him a bed, he confesses, we                  * take the bed away. At most it's one                  * night.                                               *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cantrell weighs it, decides:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're talking a high-profile double homicide. Order the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde watches as MAINTENANCE MEN remove the unbolted cot the cell and his Sleep-Matic is rolled in. CONVICTS watch, dumbfounded. Clyde's cellmate, a towering Aryan Brother named DWIGHT DIXON, stands quietly amazed..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pre-lap) Switching the drugs was easy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in the birdcage:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hacked the Fedex database, diverted the package to me, made the switch, sent the package on. It's automated tracking numbers moving millions of packages daily. Nobody's questioning who receives what, or why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the prison phones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a phone company uniform, hack the prison database, schedule an official visit. They'll wave you through the gate, like they did me. It's simple if you know how things work. (off Nick's look) It's a system. You learn how it works. You play it. Any system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) I saw him die. That stuff burned his veins. He suffered terribly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Score.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick flips to a new page on his pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's move on to Clarence Darby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sits back)                                   * Hey, you like music?
