dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitates)                                   * Very much. Why?                                      *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could tell. I love music. All of                   * it. It's like air in my lungs. So the thing about Clarence Darby is, I want my record collection and player brought to me. The vinyl discs as well as CDs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reactions all around the room. Iger leans forward:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vinyl records and CDs can be broken into shards. They make excellent weapons. My answer to that one, Mr. Clyde, is not no, but hell no.                       *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde absorbs that, looks to Nick, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a legitimate concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, calls to Iger) How about my ipod and speaker dock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN IPOD AND SPEAKER DOCK now occupy a small plywood shelf attached to the railing outside Clyde's cell. A GUARD plu it in via a long orange extension cord. ANGLE WIDENS to Iger, who turns to the bars and hands a r control through to Clyde. Dixon's watching balefully, as every inmate on the cellblock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The player stays out here. You hand the remote to the on-duty guard every night at lights out. Those terms aren't negotiable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate your compromise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iger draws close to the bars. Quietly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You looking to get your ass kicked? (off Clyde's look) By every inmate on this cellblock. You keep this up, they'll take it out on you. Harshly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde glances back to Dwight. Dwight's watching, glowerin agreement in his silence. Clyde turns back to Iger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just trying to keep you alive in here. That's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iger walks away. Clyde aims the remote. MUSIC STARTS PLAY He leans his head on the bars, listening, blissed. Cons a over the cellblock are staring daggers at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pre-lap) I took his fingers with a bolt cutter. His toes with a pair of tin snips. His balls with a hacksaw...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...his penis with a box cutter. His skin with a filet knife. His teeth with pliers. His eyes...for those I used my fingers. (looks to Nick) Check the video I made. All that will match up. I kept him alive for an hour, give or take. Time it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick trades looks with the others in the room -- everybod have what they need? People nod. Nicks closes his pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My office types it up, you sign.

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: Nick rises, putting things in his briefcase. People get r to leave -- but Clyde motions Garza to keep it rolling. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a signing bonus? The small concessions you've made so far have kept my cooperation flowing...why not give me a reward for signing? NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to sign, don't sign. We've got you on videotape, we'll go to trial. In ten years, when your appeals are exhausted, I'll attend your execution. I'll make sure nobody tampers with the drugs. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be such a hard-ass, Nick. I don't want much. Just a good meal. (directed at Iger)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The food here? Sucks. No offense. Dunnigan glances at Nick and stifles a smile, enjoying wh this is going in spite of himself: DUNNIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you have in mind? CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a place in town on Halston. La Traviata. Ever been?                            * DUNNIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a little above my pay grade. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it, don't you, Nick?                      * NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've eaten there. So?                              * CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They cater. Tonight, at 7 p.m., I                  * would like my meal delivered to my cell from La Traviata. With nice silverware, crisp linens... NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not gonna happen. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I have no interest in making it happen. And you have nothing left to bargain with. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Nick. We've just started bargaining. You haven't even heard what I'm offering yet. This makes people pause. Something in the tone of his voi CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Lowell? Is your laptop still on? Would you please do a search? She flips the laptop opens, dread mounting even though sh not sure why, poises her fingers over the keys. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William...Baxter...Reynolds. Cantrell's quietly stunned as the name sinks in. Pin-drop silence now. Laptop keys CLACKING SOFTLY. People frozen. DUNNIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's William Reynolds? CANTRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarence Darby's defense attorney. He brokered the testimony deal with us ten years ago. He's been missing now since...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: March of '06. Sarah spins the laptop -- a photo of Reynolds, a story of disappearance. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detectives Dunnigan and Garza will like this offer, Nick. It'll clear one of their department's missing- persons files. And it'll solve them their third homicide this week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you think I located Clarence Darby after he got out of jail and legally changed his name? Reynolds told me -- though it took some                       * convincing.                                          *

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: PUSH IN ON Clyde in the frozen silence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want the location of the body? Tonight, 7 p.m., I get my meal                    * delivered to my cell from La Traviata.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HELICOPTER THROTTLES UP, everything moving fast: an FBI FIELD TEAM, led by AGENT SAM DAVIES, emerges from a stair door onto the roof, where they are met by Nick and Dunnig Davies dons his kevlar vest on the move toward the waitin copter, everybody SHOUTING over the rotors:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPECIAL AGENT SAM DAVIES, NICK PRICE WITH THE D.A.'S OFFICE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK! TELL ME ABOUT THIS BODY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSPECT SAYS NEW JERSEY! ACROSS THE STATE LINE! THAT MAKES IT FEDERAL, THAT MAKES IT YOU!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to another FED) GET THE CAMDEN OFFICE TO HAVE A GROUND TEAM MEET US! (to Dunnigan) LOCATION?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSPECT WILL GIVE US A GPS MARK! WE'LL ADVISE YOU IN THE AIR!

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: They get to the helicopter, feds loading in as Nick pulls business card, hands it to Davies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davies gets in, signals the PILOT. The copter takes to th air, buffeting Nick and Dunnigan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON CLYDE. He looks up, speaking slowly and clearly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GPS position is as follows...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: FBI HELICOPTER THUNDERING over the city...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...delta niner foxtrot...GPS                           * coordinates follow...                                  *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter veers, banks into a steep turn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick enters, moves through the bullpen. ADAs (assistant district attorneys) are working and grimly focused. Nick his head into Sarah's office. She looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we have so far?                                *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HIGH-END DELIVERY VAN bearing the logo of La Traviata i waved through the gate into the delivery entrance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got no next-of-kin. No family                     * since his wife and daughter were                       * killed...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: THE FBI HELICOPTER THUNDERS over beautiful green hills...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a tinkerer. Little inventions                     * and gizmos...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick gazing out the window, Cantrell seated with his dog, Sarah reading the report thus far:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...he holds two dozen patents that have made him a lot of money the last ten years. He's invested a lot of it in real estate. Weird stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weird how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Properties with no real value. Around                  * airports, chemical plants. Stuff                       * nobody wants...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CONVICT comes to his bars, peering out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...because here comes the rolling La Traviata cart -- gle domes keeping food warm, silver utensils, crisp linens, a ROSE in a bud vase. A red-jacketed LA TRAVIATA WAITER is pushing the cart, accompanied by GUARDS and Warden Iger. More cons appear at their bars, faces peering, an angry g growing in the cellblock as the cart goes by. The waiter' looking around, nervous...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He votes. He gives money to charity, mostly victim's funds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but he also gives a big chunk to macular research.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks up) He donates to eye research?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RPI. That's the charity you work with, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. Strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiter, hemmed by guards, nervously reads the order:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...consomm...sea bass...squab...                     * New York strip, rare...a variety of                   * pates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rack of lamb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...oh, yes, rack of lamb...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE HELICOPTER ROARS IN, lands. Davies and his men jump o AN FBI GROUND TEAM is waiting for them. A CAMDEN FIELD AG runs up and points at the ground, shouting:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davies signals his team. SHOVELS AND PICKS hit the ground

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...while GORGEOUS FOOD hits paper plates. It's being slop unceremoniously from the fine china by the guards. TILT U Iger overseeing this process, passing china and utensils the waiter, who's flustered:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're bruising the crepes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life's a bitch, then you die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...no plates, they break into nice jagged pieces...nothing sharp, nothing that can be made sharp...no forks, no knives, no spoons....lose that carafe...we will have no potential weapons of any kind this evening, thank you...you can eat with your fingers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guards will think me gauche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde's got the rose, teasing his nose with it. All aroun the cellblock, inmates are shouting insults and threats..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah is exiting, leaving Nick and Cantrell to stare at t phone and wait for it to ring...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls after her) Thanks. Keep digging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Digging. Sod coming off, being set aside on plastic. FLAS PHOTOS being taken. Stones being pried up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiter and guards exit with the cart. The entire cellbloc SHOUTING. Iger pauses, gives a final glance back. Softly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he too departs, as:

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: aims his remote. MUSIC for dining. Clyde glances back at Dwight, who's poised and tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose if I don't share, you'll beat the shit out of me. Make me squeal like a piggy. That sort of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde motions "join me, won't you?" They each take a seat Clyde passes Dwight a crisply-folded linen napkin. Dwight tucks it like a bib. Clyde lays his on his lap. A hurled object CLANGS off their bars. The cons are now throwing things, hollering to raise the dead. Clyde crank the music a bit louder, motions for Dwight to dig in. Dwight goes for it, cramming food in his mouth and grabbi for more, fingers digging in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...fingers digging in, pulling loose soil, prying stones. layer of soil is brushed aside to reveal: A face. Embedded in the dirt. He's been there a long time FLASH PHOTOS highlight desiccated lips and teeth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...lips and teeth -- Dwight chewing, laughing. Oddly enou he and Clyde seem to have started enjoying each other's company. THE MUSIC PLAYS in bizarre counterpoint to: THE CACOPHONY of an angry cellblock -- if the cons weren' their cells, this would be a riot. All imaginable items a being hurled through bars: toilet paper rolls, books, sho clothes, all raining down, showering the cellblock floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder what the little people are eating tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwight throws his head back and laughs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...while, in deep silence, Nick unwraps a sorry-looking d sandwich, swaps his pickles for Cantrell's potato salad ( long-standing ritual). They both keep glancing at the pho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as Clyde and Dwight indulge their food orgy. Dialogue not important, so we won't hear any -- we'll let the MUSI take over and carry -- because it's all about tone: They're laughing and talking, winding each other up. And more Clyde wisecracks, the more Dwight laughs. Clyde finishes gnawing a lamb rack and says something to about the ruckus. Dwight turns, glances out, as: Clyde casually, but with purpose, lowers the bone onto hi lap -- adding it to one already there. He picks up a fres one, starts chewing the meat off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark enough now for flashlights. In the beams, we see the body mostly excavated. Forensic team members gather, in g and breather masks, getting ready to try lifting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's see if we can get him out in one piece...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE FINDS Davies at the helicopter, activity around him holding Nick's card and dialing a cell phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde laughing, chewing, gnawing that third bone. ANGLE C DOWN as he brings it to his lap...

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: TIGHT REVEAL: His napkin wrapped tightly around his hand provides padding for his palm. The two earlier bones are already held between his fingers -- he places the third, a fist -- and the bones now protrude from his clenched kn like a trio of spikes. TILT UP to Clyde...he reaches across, turns a paper plate over to cover the crepes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE RINGS. Nick snatches it up. He listens, looks t Cantrell...nods. They found the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Davies, B.G., the body's being extracted from the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...gently on three...one...two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on cell) --we'll have to wait for the autopsy results, but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM -- the GRAVE ERUPTS as HALF A DOZEN BURIED CLAYMORE pop like firecrackers, knocking Davies forward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and Clyde lunges, face no longer laughing, the rolling cart slamming into the wall as the lamb bones protruding his fist go slamming into Dwight's throat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the dust cloud cascades across the hillside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and Clyde has Dwight pinned on the floor against the b arm ramming like a piston, punching those bones into Dwig throat again and again, blood everywhere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON NICK holding the phone. He knows something awful just happened on the other end:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Davies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An open CELL PHONE lies on the grass. Feet stumble haltin into the shot. TILT UP TO:

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: Davies, dazed, staring offscreen in shock. Dust and smoke billowing. People running, shouting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde rises into the shot, calm now, covered with blood. unwraps the napkin from his hand, snaps it open, uses it wipe the blood from his face. He takes his seat, positions the cart, uncovers the crepe and resumes eating...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A steel gate slides open, revealing Nick. Flanking him ar Cantrell, Dunnigan, Davies (banged up and bandaged), Iger others. They move toward us with purpose, grim and resolu Sarah bringing up the rear with a young ADA named ROYCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you have him in the dome?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed his cellmate. We had to separate him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with solitary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have the authority. Not without a court order. This place was re-opened under protest as it is. Some areas are off-limits to our use -- tied up in a legal challenge by the ACLU as cruel and unusual. Especially solitary. (off Nick's look) It was nicknamed the dungeon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sarah) Get Judge Burch on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah speed-dials as a GUARD lets them in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde waits in the birdcage, shackled. The group spreads the room, silence thick. Nobody will enter the birdcage t time. Clyde occupies it alone -- owning it, in fact -- as BLUE   -   9-19-08                                   60. IGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice trick with the rack of lamb. Didn't see that one coming. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you kill your cellmate? CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I claim self-defense. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's what I think. You suckered us in. You ordered that meal for the purpose of killing him. CANTRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which makes it premeditated. Again. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, again, you'll have to prove that in court. As I've said before... (to Nick)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...make your case. Or set me free. DAVIES (pissed, moving forward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your booby-trap killed two of mine            * and put four in the hospital. That            * brings the total of people you've             * killed to six -- and be advised the           * Bureau does not suffer losing agents in the field. (turns)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're done dancing. I have the right to claim jurisdiction here, do I not, Detective Dunnigan? DUNNIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is correct, Agent Davies. DAVIES (again to Clyde)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. I'm gonna rendition your ass. Rumor has it we have places that make Guantanamo look like Disneyland. Don't bother packing, you're gonna disappear. CLYDE (beat, glances to Nick)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, Nick? That man is pissed! That's what I'm talking about! No deals, no compromise! You see? NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you totally disconnected from reality, that's what I see!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing off phone) Judge Burch with an answer for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the ACLU's biggest fundraiser in this state. You wanna put that piece of shit in solitary? Good. As far as I'm concerned, you can bury him in the bowels of hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Judge Burch. (hangs up, looks to Iger)                     * Consider your court order signed. (moves to Clyde) Freedom? Not likely. In fact, you just bought a one room suite in the dungeon. Very exclusive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have it all to yourself -- the first man down there in over twenty years. Quite an achievement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde sinks with a sigh of resignation and defeat, rests head wearily on the bars. Nick moves in, speaking quietly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're doing everything wrong. Making all the wrong moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would seem that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wording catches Nick -- but he dismisses it, turns:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam. I know you got hit hard. I know you're furious. But I'd like my shot at prosecuting this case. (off Davies' look)                            * This started with us. Let me finish                  * it. Give me that chance.                             *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm seeing fire in your belly, Nick. I like it. Keep going. This is our deal, after all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not mistake this! This is not about the two of you!

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: CLYDE (shouts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up, blind man! It's been exactly that since I watched him shake Clarence Darby's hand on the steps of the Hall of Justice ten years ago! The Hall of Justice! His voice echoes off. In the silence that follows: DAVIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna take this fuck down? Be my guest. Whatever you need. CLYDE (bangs his bars)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the spirit, yes! (to Nick)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on you now, Nick. It's your game to lose. Just don't screw up. You do, they'll scapegoat you. That's         * how the justice system works.                 * (to Davies)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good call, Sam. Making me disappear was a bad idea. You couldn't have handled the blowback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blowback?                                     * CLYDE                           *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause and effect. Your actions                * provoke reactions. The choices you            * make come back to haunt you.                  * (off their looks)                      *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are things I've set in motion.          * Dominoes that will fall. Didn't see           * the rack of lamb coming? Start a list. All I can do at this point...if I feel like it...is stop them from happening. Ready to talk deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're insane. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See how insane you think this is. You're going to release me from this place with all charges dropped within twenty four hours...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or what? CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or I start killing everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The Dungeon" -- a small underground block of FIVE CELLS back a century or more. A GUARD is spraying WD-40 into th lock of a cell, trying to turn the key. It finally does, Clyde is brought in. GUARDS have him on poles connected t leather collar around his neck, and they're none too gent Clyde tosses a final glance back at Nick and Iger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clock's running, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and then he's gone, shoved inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and the others exit the Dome, thoughts racing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can he do? We've got him boxed in. He's isolated, for God's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's keep him that way. Strict rules apply. Law says he gets one hour outside his cell a day, that's what he gets. Just one, under heavy guard. The other twenty-three hours, he's in that cell, he's a ghost, he doesn't exist. No contact whatsoever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it was a bluff?                              *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We underestimated him before. I'd like to know what this prick is capable of. (calls to Sarah) Update on the background check?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Properties, investments, a few small                   * businesses he owns -- a lot of it's                    * hidden behind false names and shell                    * companies, but we're still digging...                  *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it? Nothing else unusual?                       *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last twenty years, he's been                       * Joe Blow Citizen. But prior to that,                   * we've hit a blank spot. He used to                     * do consulting for the government,                      * but we can't pin down what.                            *

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: They absorb this -- especially Davies. All eyes go to him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of government work leaves a blank spot, Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make a few discreet calls. See what I can find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Expensive, upscale. We find Nick and Kell at a table. She got her menu, but her attention's really on Nick. He's to absently with his wine glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (catches himself) Million miles away. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be. This guy's really doing a number on your head, isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I guess he is. (she expects more) It's...killing his cellmate. I need that to make sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Happens in prison all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know, but...we're not talking some gang-banger. This man is precise. Does things for a reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's psycho. You said so yourself. We saw it on that video. Psychos don't need a reason, Nick. They're just psycho. (off his look) Whatever. You'll figure it out. You                  * always do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Thanks. I'm a poor excuse, though. It's date night. You deserve better. (a glance around) Just wish you'd picked another                       * restaurant.                                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is our place. You love it here.                   * (as a waiter approaches) You should have said something...                      *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She raises her menu -- yes, we're in La Traviata. And the waiter is the same guy who brought Benson Clyde his meal:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have we decided?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's CELL PHONE RINGS. He pulls it, checks the number, them a look -- sorry, gotta take this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam? What is it? (beat) Not far, maybe six blocks. I'm having dinner with my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two words: doggy bag. Be in your office in ten minutes.                                 * (beat) Nick, don't ask questions. I was on the phone all day. Believe me when I say we've got one shot at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clicks off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and faces Nick and Cantrell in the dimly-lit office:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's coming here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'm told. It's called inter-agency cooperation, but don't ask me what agency because I wouldn't know. This isn't even back-channels, this is Theseus in the fucking Labyrinth. (off their looks) I just blew thirty years' worth of favors today calling in this one chit. I hope it's worth it.                            *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The desk phone RINGS. Nick answers, listens a beat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes, we're all here. Downstairs? Okay. Understood. (hangs up) He said not to take the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off their puzzled looks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huge, descending seven floors, circles within circles dro into darkness. Nick and Davies lead the way down. Cantrel brings up the rear with his dog and cane...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They freeze. Nick and Davies peer down. They start to mak out a FIGURE in the murky darkness one level below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one of you is Davies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davies takes a step forward. THE SPOOK eases partially in the light -- flinty gaze, military-style haircut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be well thought of, Agent Davies. I don't do this. But I was asked nicely by the right people. They briefed me on your problems with Benson Clyde.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we dealing with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things I can neither confirm nor deny. Things of which, if I'm asked, I will disavow any knowledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys trade a look. Cantrell can't help chuckling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Davies) You gotta be kidding me with this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not. Tell me you grasp the implication of what I've said, or we're done here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smile fades) Yeah. Okay. I get it.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE
dialogues.text: NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was Clyde? Some kind of spy? SPOOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooks like me are a dime a dozen. Clyde was a brain. He ran a think- tank, inventing things for use in the field. Ways to kill people. (off their looks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to get rid of somebody. It's not a situation where you can get close. What do you do? NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask Clyde? SPOOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Ask Clyde. And he'd figure something out. Gizmos, strategy. He was good at it. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How good? SPOOK (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You play chess? NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Tournament level in college, matter of fact. SPOOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my line, we use an aptitude profile based on chess. A tournament- level player like you can think five to eight steps ahead of an average player, did you know that? Me, I think about ten steps ahead, so I'd take you in a game. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Clyde? SPOOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off the charts. If you're eight steps ahead, he's twenty. Or fifty. He's already got the game won on the first move, you don't even know you're playing yet. (further into the light)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This cellmate he killed? You think that was random? Bullshit. That was a pawn taken off the board. If I were you, I'd be trying to figure out what the move was.

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have been. Any thoughts? SPOOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Top of my head? Was the cellmate ever connected with this case? Or with Clyde? Was anybody else in that facility? Guards? Cons? The janitor? Any connection at all, no matter how remote. Because if Clyde says he has things in play, he does. DAVIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what? He's locked up. What can he do? SPOOK (gives him a look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an average chess player, aren't you? DAVIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I kind of suck. SPOOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can tell. But I like your tie. DAVIES (perplexed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Father's Day. SPOOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's this tie -- we call it the Albert, after Albert DeSalvo. They tiptoe in one night, thread a piano wire with a ratchet gizmo into one of your ties. Sounds crazy, but                     * trust me it works. You put your tie                 * on and all day long it slowly tightens. You don't even notice it's cutting off the blood-flow to your brain. Then you drop dead. Brain-dead or plain dead, doesn't much matter at that point. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde invented that. The Spook melts back into the shadows. The guys crane for trying to see. There's a brief spill of light below as a doorway opens and closes...he's gone. The three of them stand there absorbing everything they'v heard. Nick sits on a step. Quiet looks are traded... ...and they all start taking off their ties...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick enters tie-less, subdued, distracted. Kell and Emma in the living room playing Scrabble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma jumps up and runs over for a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom said I could stay up late. Wanna play Scrabble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me talk to mom first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma returns to the couch. Kell comes to Nick, noticing h weird vibe: he's looking around at the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about date night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine. You learn anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thing or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves up the hallway -- slowly, as if noticing the wal for the first time, the picture frames, the light fixture

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (following him) Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I was thinking. Maybe you could pack an overnight bag for you and Emma in case you need to...you know...spend the night in a hotel. Or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would we wanna do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reason. It's like a fire-drill thing. You know. In case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes in, opens the closet, reaches up for some overni bags -- but pauses, drawn to his tie-rack inside the door He stares at the ties hanging in neat rows...starts touch them, running his hands up and down the fabric...

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: Kell stands in the doorway watching. Wondering what the f is going on. And getting a little creeped out. KELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey? He freezes, feeling something in the seam of a tie. Runs fingers up and down, thinking something's in there. Emma appears in the doorway too, at her mother's side. Bo staring now. They watch as: Nick grabs a pair of scissors from Kell's sewing kit, car the tie lengthwise, rips it open, feverish and faster, fi nothing inside but mangled fabric and thread and -- stops Looks back. Realizes they're staring at him. KELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing? Nick pauses -- what the hell is he doing? He starts to re his sense, laughs at himself in amazement. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy? NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, baby -- I'm fine, I promise. Go back to your game. Dubious, Emma departs. As soon as she's out of earshot: KELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, Nick. What the fuck. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I got paranoid for no reason, that's all. I'm fine now. I can't believe I let that son of a bitch Clyde get to me like that. KELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you in danger? Are we? The question hangs there -- the real question. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure we're fine.                               * He pulls his phone, speed-dials. NICK                                 *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make goddamn sure.                            * (beat, into phone)                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah, roust the ADAs. Tell 'em                    * we're pulling an all-nighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAs are parking their cars along the wall, directed by a waving GUARD. ANGLE FINDS a lot of people: cop, prison, F Sarah jumps out of her car and hurries over to Nick and t others with a flock of EIGHT ADAs at her heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready to turn this place upside down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...we find the ADA team spread around the bullpen, aided prison personnel and police advisors -- everybody's on computers, or sorting heaps of paper files, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See if there's anybody locked up here -- or working here -- ex-cop, witness for the prosecution -- anybody who might have had anything to do with the original Darby-Ames case, or has any previous history with Benson Clyde. Start with the cellmate. Flag anything, no matter how insignificant it seems...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMESON glances up in dismay from his keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This could take days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah, grabbing a stack from a filing cabinet and slammin the door shut with her hip, gives him a laser look:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We boring you, Jameson? You got someplace to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Miss Lowell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crossing the room) Weekend plans? Cancel 'em! I don't wanna hear any shit about it! (on Jameson again) Clack-clack, Jameson. Clack-clack.

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: Jameson dives onto the keys, starts clack-clacking. Sarah gives Nick a nod -- she's got this in hand. Nick exits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and finds a FORENSIC TEAM disassembling Clyde's Sleep- bed -- nuts, bolts, struts, electronics. The mattress is razored open, wadding pulled out and run under fluoroscop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It used to be a Sleep-Matic adjustable bed. Now it's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA FOLLOWS them to a table where an FBI TEAM is focus all their skills and tech on Clyde's ipod and speaker doc The TEAM LEADER places the buds in his ears, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky Mountain Way. Joe Walsh. (off Nick's look) What do you want from me, it's a fucking ipod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other agents snicker, not hiding their amusement, but

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tear it apart, make sure. Memory.                      * Speakers. Wiring. Everything.                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUARDS, FEDS, BOMB-SNIFFING DOGS -- they're cruising the cellblocks, flashlights swiveling, beams catching the fac of sleepy cons in their cells or at their bars... We find Nick and Iger at Clyde's now-empty cell. TWO FBI emerge, shake their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood stain. Few fibers. That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sleepy, at his bars) Warden, man, whassup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody back to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks to Iger) I want to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two doors: solid steel outer door, inner barred door. The outer slides aside, reveals Nick outside the bars. Inside stands a shadow, waiting: Clyde.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're up early. Trouble sleeping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a good bluff. But you're done. Fucking with my head. Scaring                    * my family half to death. Done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde moves closer to the bars, into the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazing, isn't it? How primal that is. That pull? What a man is capable of when it comes to his family?                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You strip away all the polite shit,                    * that's what we're really about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you never face what it is to                    * lose them, Nick. It's like dying yourself. There's nothing worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That could play as a threat, of course -- but it's not. I genuine. And pained. And sincere. And Nick knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then the moment's gone and the mocking Clyde returns:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it casual Friday? (off Nick's look) I've never seen you not wear a tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that says volumes: Clyde's totally aware of what they been up to and is tickled by it. The outer door GRINDS SHUT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night has passed, day is coming. All the earlier energy h dissipated into anticlimax and weariness. People straggle across the yard in groups toward their vehicles...

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: Nick, Dunnigan, Davies, Iger -- all look whipped. Sarah approaches, briefcase in hand, files under her arm. SARAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We dug pretty deep for one night. Still got a ways to go, but on a first look? Nothing. Nada. Zip. IGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's good news. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So far. Now we double-down. Make                    * absolutely certain.                                 * (nods after ADAs)                            *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let them all sleep a few hours,                     * then bring 'em back for round two.                  * SARAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Due diligence. My middle name.                      * She trudges toward her car, following the ADAs toward the vehicles. Nick trades relieved looks with the men -- ever coming down from a tense night. Davies shakes their hands DAVIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fellas. For once, glad not to be of assistance. DUNNIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love it when they cry wolf. The men separate in different directions. Dunnigan catche glimpse of Sarah almost at her car -- she loses a page fr under her arm, which flutters away on the breeze. DUNNIGAN (calls to her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Lowell! Lost something! She looks back, sees the page skittering slowly across th ground. Weary, she blows a strand of hair from her eyes, down her briefcase, walks back to get it... Dunnigan smiles, keeps walking. The other men too. Nick s a moment, watching, then starts toward his car... The ADAs are getting to their cars, pulling key fobs, aim them to unlock their cars... Sarah is getting to the page, leaning down... The ADAs are pressing the remotes, a CHORUS OF CHIRPS... And WHAM -- the cars EXPLODE in a stunning SERIES OF DETONATIONS, killing the ADAs, throwing bodies through th air, kicking cars off the ground and flipping a few skywa

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: Nick is knocked flat by heat and shrapnel ripping the air Sarah goes flying. An arcing car slams upside-down nearby a rocket-booster of flame and shattering axle... And from this point on the visuals and sound are surreal:

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: pries himself off the ground, stunned, looking around, tr to figure out what the fuck just happened. He's disorient all sound muffled. Smoke drifting. Flames billowing. Dunnigan runs up to Nick, shouting something. We can't te what, because Nick can't hear. Dunnigan sees Nick is aliv turns and keeps going, running to help the others... Nick looks over, sees bodies being pulled clear by respon men running in, beating at flames... Nick, dazed, looks through the drifting smoke and sees Sa trying to sit up. There's something wrong with her leg. Nick pulls himself to his knees, staggers to his feet as filters back in: screams, shouts, the roar of flames. He stumbles through the smoke to Sarah. She's on the grou in shock, sobbing and flailing, crying out. Nick sees the jagged piece of metal that slammed deep into her calf, ne severing it. He drops to his knees, tries to calm her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna be all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls the metal from her leg -- mistake. Blood sprays. clamps down hard with both hands, blood going everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEDIC! I NEED A MEDIC!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps clamping down, Sarah screaming and sobbing, as w

dialogues.speaker: IN A SERIES OF FADE-TO-BLACKS, THE FOLLOWING IMAGES
dialogues.text: FIREMEN spraying the flaming rubble of the cars... TANGLES OF WRECKAGE billowing smoke... A BODY BAG dragged across the ground, added to a ROW OF B BAGS awaiting transport... EMERGENCY VEHICLES parked haphazardly, lights spinning... COPS AND RESPONDERS dealing with the scene...

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: SARAH being wheeled on a gurney to a PARAMEDIC VAN by an TEAM, oxygen mask on her face, gravely injured but stabil everything swirling around her, Dunnigan clearing a path. NICK appears, takes her hand. She clasps it weakly. They her on and the vehicle pulls out with siren and lights...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to "real time" -- Cantrell is just getting out of hi town car with his dog. WE FIND Nick on his cell:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on cell) Baby. Listen. Don't be worried or scared. But I want you to pack those overnight bags... I don't have time to explain now. Just do it, okay? I'll call you back as soon as I can -- please, honey, I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clicks off as ANGLE COMES AROUND, revealing Davies and TEAMS coming his way:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each car had an explosive charge on the gas tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got someone working with him. On the outside. He's got to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not necessarily. Everything looks pre-rigged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found a short-range transmitter beacon buried outside the prison wall. When your people showed up here and drove in through the gate, the signal armed the bombs.                           *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could have planted those bombs a month ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grappling for sense) No...no, we've got two dozen ADAs on payroll. Those eight were picked last night on the spur of the moment. How could he know which eight would show up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't. Our people just found bombs on every car in your ADA pool. All two dozen. We're disarming those now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON CLYDE shoved into the birdcage. The neck-poles a disengaged. He moves forward, gazing through the bars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a phone in my cell. If I'm conducting my own defense, it would be useful. Also in case you and I need to be in touch, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glances at clock) Your twenty four hours are about up. In return for the phone, I'll extend you another twelve hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many more people die while you stand around dithering? How many do you get killed before my point starts sinking in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cantrell closes in, tracking Clyde by voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker! Whatever point you had was lost long ago! Eight kids dead in that yard, most of them just out of college! Eight! I have to talk to their families. I have to try to explain why their loved ones are dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde leans down, right in Cantrell's face, intense:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been waiting for my explanation for ten years. So far... (shouts) ...NOBODY'S FUCKING BOTHERED!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Cantrell spits in his face, turns away trembling wi rage. Clyde calmly wipes it off, rises to address them al

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it hasn't dawned on you, this is a war. As in any war, there will be collateral damage. The question, as always, is how much damage you're willing to take before you withdraw. DUNNIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I got a better idea. Maybe we end this war right now. (looks around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourteen people dead! I have to say                  * this out loud? (moving toward Clyde)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prisoners die in custody all the time. Attacking a guard. Trying to escape. Shit like that. Clyde, eyes locked, pulls his shirt open -- here's your t Dunnigan, temper flaring, yanks his revolver and aims. DUNNIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tempt me. GARZA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, man, dial it back... CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it. It would be decisive. Stupid, but decisive. (off Dunnigan's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you handle the blowback, Detective? The "shit like that?" Nick's stunned, seeing the whole situation spiraling out control. He steps in, seizing the moment back: NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the gun away! Are you crazy? DUNNIGAN (calmly reholsters)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an option. All I'm saying. Risk the blowback. Ride it out. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not risking anything. Or letting him tear us down. (to Clyde)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not getting us to throw out the rules, like you. No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like rules. I've wanted you to follow them from the start. Like the one that says you prosecute a man who murders my family. (re-buttons) So. Rules. A phone buys you another twelve hours. But if you haven't cut my deal and let me go by the deadline...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll kill someone in this room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sucks the air out of the conversation -- everybody s as that sinks in. Glances are traded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at the room full of people, scans their faces as trying to pick. He points his finger, starts going from o end of the group to the other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eenie...meenie...miney...moe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...from person to person, to the end, moving back again..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...my mother...told me...to pick...a person...and that...person...is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lands on Cantrell. Silence. Cantrell obviously can't s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's he pointing at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody on the move, emotions high:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck him. Let him try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not helpful! We have fourteen                  * dead! You could ask them what he's capable of, but they're in no position to answer.

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: CANTRELL (beat, tight)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Point taken. DAVIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll give him his phone. We'll tap in and monitor every call. DUNNIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buys us another twelve hours, we could use that right now. That puts the deadline at... (checks his watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...about 7:30 tonight. CANTRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. I'll be in front of a room full of lawyers. The A.B.A. dinner. I'm the keynote speaker. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. Find a replacement. DUNNIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until his deadline passes, you're in protective custody. Not negotiable. Cantrell isn't happy about it -- but nods. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And have them switch the location of that dinner. CANTRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's last minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. He could have gotten your schedule in advance -- been planning to take you out at the dinner along with everybody else. That eenie- meenie act could have been horseshit. (off their looks) We have to get a few moves ahead. Plan for every contingency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way, Mr. Cantrell. Garza, you're with Mr. Price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They split up. Dunnigan leads Cantrell to an unmarked car while Nick and Garza head toward Nick's. Nick's phone RIN He checks the number, answers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey baby -- no, I'm fine. Really. Honey, calm down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He listens a beat, calls to the men getting in the other

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our shit just hit the fan in a big way -- we're all over the news... (on phone) Yes, all eight died. Sarah's in surgery right now... (beat) ...they think so, but... (beat) ...okay, I'll meet you there. Love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up, aims his key fob -- and hesitates. He and Ga trade a look, thinking the same thought. ANGLE SHIFTS to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're good. Car's been swept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it has. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, feeling foolish, presses the fob. Nothing but a tin CHIRP. He and Garza get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunnigan drives. Cantrell and his dog ride in back. Both tense and silent. TWO POLICE CRUISERS provide escort...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is pulling up toward the hospital, sees a TV NEWS VA the entrance, a MINICAM CREW arguing with hospital securi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go around. I'll get us in back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick hits the gas, drives past the news van...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and they come past the nurse's duty desk. UNIFORMS are stationed in the hallway. Garza pushes a path through:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep the press off this floor, understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick squeezes past. The floor is busy. He finds Kell in t waiting area. She looks up, spots him. Kell rises. She and Nick pull into a tight embrace. No wo for a long moment. Kell's shaken, fighting tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in surgery now. They're saying she'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God. That's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good? You'll have to explain the good part, Nick. I'm missing it. This is crazy. What if something happened to you? What would I say to Emma? What would we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't lose me. You won't. Does the school know we're pulling Emma out of class?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called, yeah, but -- I'd rather be here for Sarah when she wakes up. Nick -- and for you. I want to do something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are. Getting our daughter out of harm's way. And yourself. (calls to Garza) Detective. Will you escort my wife, please? (to Kell) There's not much time. I'll be there to see you off. Okay? Please?

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: Kell reluctantly walks away with Garza, while:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A media frenzy is brewing: TRUCKS pulling in, NEWS CREWS gathering. ANGLE TO A REPORTER on-camera:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...reporting live from a tense scene at City Hall...we have confirmation of earlier reports that eight people with the district attorney's office were killed this morning in an explosion at the County Correctional Annex in George Hill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick enters, finds the STAFF around the bullpen watching same live report. Everybody's in shock, a few are crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...details are sketchy at this point, and names are being withheld...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People start noticing Nick. Royce comes up, looking dazed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah's fine. That's the good news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, that's a relief... (calls to the others) Miss Lowell is okay...she's okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody reacts -- they needed a shred of good news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been getting calls from upstairs. The mayor's people. (off Nick's look) Someone from our office has to make a statement to the press. With Mr. Cantrell absent, the mayor wants you to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause, thinking) Royce...how much petty cash do we have in the safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...four thousand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it to me. And your cell phone. I need to borrow it for a few days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, puzzled) What do you want me to tell the mayor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIGURE enters shot, pushes a door open into glaring day CAMERA FOLLOWS him outside to a podium set up before a sw MOB OF PRESS shouting questions. ANGLE COMES AROUND to re Royce, nervous, leaning to the microphones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We in the D.A.'s office are still reeling from the events of this morning, as you can imagine. It's a tragic day for us...for our city...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kell and Emma on the platform, Garza hovering nearby, CRO swarming around them as boarding calls come over the P.A. system. Kell is looking around, anxious. Nick appears on the platform, hurrying. They see him. Emm runs, throws herself into Nick's arms as he crouches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna see Sarah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey...she's fine, don't be scared. That's not allowed. And there's no reason for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This sucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do we have to go?

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause your mom wants to see a few Broadway shows. You gonna begrudge her that? EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kinda full of shit, Dad. Nick's taken aback -- not sure whether to laugh. He trade look with Kell, who's too tense with worry to care. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you're right. Maybe I am a little. But only a little. The part you can believe is that this is all going to be fine. Sarah, us. (directed at Kell)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean it. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. She detaches from her father. Nick rises to Kell, pulls a envelope, hands it to her... NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No credit cards. Too easy to track. Meals, hotel, whatever -- pay cash. ...then takes her cell, swaps it for Royce's... NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll keep this. It can be traced. Use this one instead. Don't answer unless you see it's me.                           * P.A. VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. KELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma's right. This sucks. She embraces him, fears and emotions swirling. KELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be goddamn careful.

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: She breaks the embrace. Nick stands, watching them get on train. The doors close. The train starts out... Nick turns. Garza's been watching -- a look of sympathy f what Nick's going through...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kell and Emma on the train, watching buildings slide by o the window. Kell troubled, holding her daughter...

dialogues.speaker: TRAIN
dialogues.text: WE FOLLOW the train traveling a path through canyons of buildings, leaving the city... ANGLE SWAPS TRAIN FOR CAR as we drift over a bridge and f Nick's car racing across the span...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Garza enter. ANGLE COMES AROUND to reveal the ho swarming with HIGH-TECH FBI FORENSIC TEAMS turning the ho upside-down, tearing things apart, X-RAY SCANNING walls.. Cantrell sits isolated, near tears of frustration, as the place is trashed around him. He glances up, hearing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.                                                 *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick? These guys won't even let me pack a bag. Not even a toothbrush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davies enters frame, accompanied by FORENSIC TECHS -- not guys from downtown, but people who work serious ops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have granules of an unidentified substance in the ice-maker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up a drinking glass with a few ice cubes, runs a black-light wand behind it -- dark granules become visibl each pass, embedded in the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm betting something lethal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like this salt. (pours a small amount) Not sodium chloride. Potassium chloride. It's a neuro-blocker, stops the heart -- they use it in lethal injections. You'd be dead before you got up from the table.                      *

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: Nick tosses the others a grim look. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, Clyde has someone          * working with him. Someone on the outside. CANTRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? Who could he have? NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody from his past. Could be            * that spook we met on the stairs,            * for all we know -- he'd know how to         * plant this shit... CANTRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him? No--why would Clyde let him come talk to us? NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To fuck with our heads? To get us to bring in our ADAs so he could blow them up? DUNNIGAN                      *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be a Clyde move. But it's          * not proof. (to Cantrell)                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could he have planted this stuff in         * your house before he was arrested? CANTRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I--I don't know... NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonas, think -- last few days, have         * you used any ice? Any salt? CANTRELL (confused, grappling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't use salt--my cholesterol. Ice? Yeah--not long ago. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before or after he was arrested? CANTRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember! You track your            * use of ice, Nick? You keep a daily          * log? TECH #2 calls from the kitchen:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heads-up! Looks like polonium here. In his tea pot. Same way the Russians killed Litvenenko. Took him two weeks to die. (off their looks) It's an exotic isotope. All you need is a trace amount. Rips through your organs and bone marrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's been listening, thunderstruck, paler by the moment looks to Cantrell sitting there, quiet and shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll buy you a new toothbrush.                         *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DRIFTING IN on a reflective glass skyscraper -- spectacul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens, revealing Nick, Cantrell, et al. They com into the room...actually, "room" undersells it. It's the spectacular suite known to man -- huge open floor plan, w a stunning view of all the downtown buildings surrounding

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm actually a little jealous Clyde didn't pick me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cantrell laughs -- and it lightens everybody's mood. Nick drifts to the windows, gazing out, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the presidential suite. Last person who stayed here was actually a president. Of a country. Security here is amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not bad, Jonas. I think you can muddle through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're muddling with him. I don't want you back at your house until my people sweep it. You need pajamas, buy some in the shop downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick nods, pulls Sarah's reports from his briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The background check my office was compiling -- these properties we                    * think Clyde owns? If he is working                  * with somebody, they could be                        * operating out of any of these. We                   * should check them.                                  *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try to wrangle additional                      * manpower. Big job.                                  *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pages the report)                           * No shit. This is quite a list. Over                 * forty locations?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not even complete. Sarah was                   * in the middle of it -- untangling property ownership from under assumed names, shell companies. She's the expert on all that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fellas... I'm grateful for all your efforts. I just wanted to say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save it for tonight. Hope you're in the mood for Chinese takeout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That stuff in your house -- it's all gone too far. I started this. I owe everybody at least one last try at defusing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STEEL DOOR opens. Clyde steps out, shackled, blinking a daylight. He comes down a short flight of steps... CAMERA COMES AROUND to reveal his surroundings: not withi prison walls, but rather behind the prison -- a loading a we haven't seen, comprised of fences and razor wire. Nick walks in the rear gate, passed through by Warden Ige himself -- this is clearly an off-the-books meeting. Nick Clyde walk to each other, meet halfway.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE
dialogues.text: CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting location you've chosen. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we'd have some privacy. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what? A talk? Or... (gazes around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you've decided to take Detective Dunnigan's advice. He's noticing GUARDS atop the prison wall and surrounding roofs -- all with sniper rifles. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be the perfect place for it. Outside the wall. Look like you were shot trying to escape.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE
dialogues.text: Nick and Clyde below. A SCOPE suddenly rises into frame, turning our shot into a SNIPER SCOPE POV, jumping Clyde's face into magnification. He smiles in the crosshairs...

dialogues.speaker: RESUME NICK AND CLYDE
dialogues.text: CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have some kind of signal worked out? You scratch your nose and blam, I'm a goner? NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might solve all your problems. What's stopping you? Afraid of the blowback? NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's to prove a     point. (off Clyde's     look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just because I have     the power, doesn't mean I have     to use it. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. Nice. Good one. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One can show mercy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercy. Right. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. So why don't you?

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: We see Clyde's brain bend a little -- trying to wrap his around it. It's almost painful for him. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we've come a little too far for that, haven't we, Nick? I mean, what do I say? Sorry, my bad? Which way to the execution chamber? NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give me that. Death doesn't scare you. CLYDE (smiles "right")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but...we're in the flow of this now. You cry havoc, you let slip the dogs of war, you go with                  * it. You don't just stop because                    * someone says hey wait. By then the dogs are dragging you. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until one side admits defeat. What if I did that? What if I said... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you were right. I was wrong. What if I say I should have prosecuted both men ten years ago? CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say you're making progress. You should have, you know. Prosecuted both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd have lost. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With your head held high. And without any blame from me. Nick's CELL RINGS -- he turns away, answers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is? Great news. I'll stop on my way back. And Royce? Put some get- well flowers in her room, they sell 'em in the lobby. Thanks. (hangs up, baleful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six hours in surgery. BLUE   -   9-19-08                                  92. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's okay -- good. Miss Lowell is a fine young woman. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey...your wife and little girl get out of town all right? NICK (beat, staring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asking that question makes me want to scratch my nose. Clyde glances around at the snipers with a laugh. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a guess. It's what I would do. Get 'em out, make sure they're safe. (reproachful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon. Like I'd ever have hurt them anyway. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are limits. Even in war. I may be many things, Nick. But I'm not Clarence Darby. I'm not Rupert Ames. I'm not that kind of monster. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind are you? CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the kind who'd hurt your wife and child. Christ, look at me. Mine were my salvation -- then they were killed -- and all I had left was this. Life without them in this fucking charnel-house world. Pause. Drawing close: CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hurt to lose them, didn't it? Your family. Even knowing they'd come back. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine knowing they wouldn't. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. I can't imagine that.               *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I envy you. For me, knowing                     * mine won't come back is the only thing that's crowded my thoughts for ten years. If I could take a rusty knife and cut out that part of my brain, I would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't make any more deals with murderers. If hearing that makes a difference...if that was the point of all this...you've won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Clyde's brain hurting again -- he's trying to beli that, would like to believe that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Counselor. I have no doubt, as we stand here, that you really believe that. I wish I could. (pause) Are we done? You gonna scratch your nose, or can I go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence now. Nothing left to say. They turn and walk in opposite directions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and Clyde is brought in, locked into gloom as the door SLAM behind him. He stands, staring at the darkness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is setting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as Nick drives back into town, crossing one of the bri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Not Cantrell's hotel, but one close by.) A SIGN reads: " Dinner." PEOPLE are entering, passing a GREETER. ANGLE FI Judge Burch arriving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECRETARY answers the ringing phone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge's chambers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura? Laura, that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Judge Burch is gone for the evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dang it. Listen, honey, I flew in from Galveston for this A.B.A thing Laura invited me to -- just got here and they said it was moved. You got a number, address, anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick peers in. Sarah's in bed, leg braced, in traction. S awake but groggy -- which isn't stopping her from giving instructions to Royce, who's scribbling notes at her beds

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...tell Hansen we need hard info on those addresses...don't let the shell game on ownership title slow him down...at this point we'll take educated guesses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah looks over, sees Nick step in, gives him a weak smi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Nice flowers. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes to the bed, takes her hand, squeezes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place has great drugs. Damn. I should've totaled my leg long ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But her emotions are in turmoil -- she puts her hands ove her face, holding back a sob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah lets herself cry. Nick waits, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're alive. That counts for a                      * lot.                                                 * (beat)                                        * I'm sorry I put you in harm's way.                   *

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: She absorbs that, angrily wipes her eyes. SARAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't you. It was that son of a bitch. I hear he's threatened Jonas?          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all over it. Jonas is safe --                 * out of reach.                                       *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cantrell on the upper level, wearing brand-new sweats, wh cane tapping the unfamiliar place, Betsy at his side. He follows VOICES around the corner... Inside a room, Garza's playing poker with three other cop LASZLO, FLEMING, and MITRIUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's winning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laszlo, the cheatin' prick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yer mama...
