dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna sit in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had my Braille set, I'd clean you out. Not much of a game if you have to tell me what my cards are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right...sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other guys toss Garza a look -- what a moron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People forget. No worries. (turns away) Enjoy your game, fellas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need help? Want one of us should walk you down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good. Unfamiliar places take me a little longer. But I get there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls after him) Holler if you need anything. (back to the game) Okay, who's in, who's out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITERS setting out salads, guests taking seats, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening. Sorry for any confusion our last-minute change of location might have caused...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That incredible city view -- skyscrapers all around, aglo with lights. Cantrell enters frame, drawn to the glass... A POLICE HELICOPTER IS ROARING slowly past out there, dri among the buildings at our eye level. Cantrell raises his hand, places it on the glass, feeling the vibrations... The copter's searchlight sweeps the windows, highlighting briefly with incredible light he can't see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but we can see the copter going by from here, searchli playing over Cantrell's building -- which is plainly visi just across the way. ANGLE WIDENS to find Judge Burch at a table, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...please join me in a warm welcome for our keynote speaker this evening, Judge Laura Burch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rises and heads for the podium amidst APPLAUSE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick exits, arms loaded down with bags of takeout, talkin his cell phone as he heads for his car:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...yes, you pain in the ass, of course I got your kung-pao...you think I'd forget...just don't give Betsy any, I can't deal with dog farts all night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cantrell's sitting in front of that incredible view with at his feet, on the phone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long, man, I'm starving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick gets to his car, checks his watch -- and pauses. The time reads: "7:27." Nick is suddenly hit with a momentary sense of dread. He glances up the street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: reveals Nick in deep f.g. looking up the broad avenue -- the distance stands Cantrell's skyscraper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm minutes away. Relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick shakes off his misgivings, hangs up, gets in the car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cantrell eases to the floor, sits with Betsy. He strokes fur. She WHINES, uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. It's gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge Burch at the podium:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Jonas was upset not to be here with you tonight...a personal matter came up...but he wanted me to give you all his fondest regards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE LOOKING UP at Cantrell's hotel -- a FIGURE steps in our shot, his back to us. He pulls a cell phone from his pocket, flips it open, sees the time: "7:29." The thumb starts pressing numbers -- boop...boop...boop..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE DRIFTING ACROSS THE FLOOR -- Cantrell and Betsy aga the incredible city view... He finally gets fed up with that surgery collar she's wor the entire movie, reaches around, unsnaps the plastic. He puts the collar aside, gently ruffs her shaggy neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. That's better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his arm around her, taking comfort in her presenc quiet, pensive moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick driving, a block from the hotel now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as the FIGURE finishes dialing. The thumb hovers a mom then presses "send." We hear the call RINGING through...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and Cantrell hears a strange SOUND...almost like a pho ringing -- sort of close but not -- weirdly muffled. He looks around, trying to pinpoint it. His head finally swivels down to Betsy lying at his side. She's WHINING, g a little freaked, licking her stitches... Cantrell's hand travels down her fur to her belly...finge tracing the stitching...and what he can't see is the stra glow building under her skin... But he can sense it. His eyes widen slightly... ...and WHAM! The room is swallowed in a DETONATION --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- which BLOWS OUT THE ROOM IN A HUGE EXPLOSION, the rows windows vanishing in a storm of flame and shattering glas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge Burch and the others gasp as the explosion lights u the night from the building across the way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick slams on his brakes -- he cranes forward, gazing up horror as the explosion is reflected in his windshield...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blast kicks from the face of the building, fireball r with eerie grace into the night sky, as: The FIGURE steps into frame, pockets the cell phone. CAME PIVOTS BEHIND him, losing Cantrell's building and bringin the other hotel into view -- the one with the lawyers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick jumps out, stunned. He runs up the street toward the hotel as glass and debris rains onto the sidewalk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People crowd to the glass, staring out at the skyscraper the way -- at the smoking ruin that was once a floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the FIGURE bends down, picks something up. He heft onto his shoulder: a LAWS ROCKET-LAUNCHER. He flips up th sight, takes aim at the other hotel, fires... WHOOOSH -- the rocket streaks, leaving a contrail...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FAST CUT: Judge Burch and those around her reacting as th glare of the rocket approaches in a heartbeat -- WHAM! OUR SECOND EXPLOSION of the night takes out the bal killing dozens, blowing flame and debris across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick sees it: the contrail, the second blast, all of it. stops him dead in his tracks. Just overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garza and his guys come stumbling and bleeding from the r they were in. They get to the top of the stairs, find the front of the suite open to the windy sky outside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping on radio) ...we need help up here...                           *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. What the fuck hit us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stares up, wondering the same thing as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 30-foot-high hand-painted domed ceiling above, an equal huge ROUND TABLE below -- an imposing room that says powe Nick is ushered in. A DOZEN OR MORE PEOPLE are seated -- echelon city brass -- political, fire, police. Also present are Davies and Dunnigan. (Dunnigan is not se he's getting his ass reamed today.)

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: The top dog: THE MAYOR. He's seething but not a screamer man who keeps it tightly reined: MAYOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're worldwide news this morning. Almost twenty dead, among them some of this country's top attorneys. I had friends in that room. Hell, I almost attended myself. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second explosion. I saw a rocket               * fired.                                             * (to Davies and Dunnigan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde does have somebody on the outside. MAYOR                                *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you saw or think you saw is                   * beside the point. What matters is                  * that the FBI wanted to rendition                   * this man out of my city. The reason                * he's still here causing havoc is you. You wanted to prosecute this case. Your ambition kept him here                  * and provoked this tragedy. DUNNIGAN (mutters)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...not entirely fair... MAYOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective. Your job is hanging by a thread. I'd think a man of your experience would know when to keep his mouth shut and his ass covered. Dunnigan -- formidable though he is -- looks away, keeps mouth shut. The Mayor approaches Nick, looks him in the e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I go in front of the cameras today -- unlike some people who seem unwilling to do so when asked -- I'm going to make goddamn sure the media doesn't hang this abject disaster around my neck. Why? Because I'm hanging it on yours. (beat) You're done. Gone. Fired. Non- existent. Get the fuck out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People going about their business. Nick exits, dazed, comes down the steps. He sits on a ste vacant -- a man completely at a loss and out of options. His CELL RINGS. He rouses himself, flips it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Some legal team from the mayor                 * showed up here this morning. I hear                 * you're off the case. Told you they'd                * scapegoat you, didn't I? (beat) Nick? You there?                                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you kill Jonas? I know about the second explosion, I saw the contrail, so I know you got somebody working for you. But the first explosion -- how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say you find a guy with a bad cocaine problem. Hungry ex-wives. Greedy mistress. Heavy gambling debts.                     *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a bizarre sound occurs on the line -- an unidentifiabl SHRIEKING SOUND that grows and rapidly dissipates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say that guy's a veterinarian. You                  * hand him a million in cash, he'll                   * do what you ask. Especially if he's                 * looking to blow town for good...

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: NICK (can't believe it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was...inside the dog? CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You own the vet, you own the dog. Explosive wasn't even that big. Stuff I use, it didn't have to be. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hidden in plain sight. That's my specialty. Haven't you figured that out yet? Nick sighs, rubs his eyes, can barely even speak. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's next for you? Mulling career options? I suppose law is out. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to get over my friend being dead. Aside from that, fuck you. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fair enough. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll miss you Nick. It was a good dance. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't bring your family back, though, did it? (off Clyde's silence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has it made you feel better? All this? You done making your point? CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just warming up. This is Clausewitz shit, my friend. Total war. CAMERA PUSHING IN on Nick, listening, as: CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna pull the whole thing down. I will topple the gleaming pillars and drag the whole fucking diseased, corrupt temple down on my head. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay tuned. It'll be Biblical. Click -- line goes dead. Nick sits staring at the phone..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick enters, finds Sarah crying. A WALL-MOUNTED TV IS PLA A NEWS REPORT of the explosions -- file footage of Jonas Cantrell pops up. Nick drifts over, sits at her bedside,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...going live now to City Hall where Mayor Tilden is about to make a statement...announcing, we're told, among other things, the dismissal of District Attorney Nick Price...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The IMAGE cuts to the Mayor stepping to the mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you all for gathering on this solemn and anxious occasion...

dialogues.speaker: WHITE
dialogues.text: Nick MUTES it. He and Sarah don't speak for long moments he's waiting for her to pull herself together. She finally does, going into professional mode, pulling h laptop and files and reports around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got the latest batch of background in. Hansen and the other guy did some good work here--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah. Give it a rest. It's over. We're done. (off her look) I'm done. The mayor is nailing my coffin shut. The best thing you can do right now is distance yourself from me as much as you can -- see what you can salvage of your career.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah is staring at him with "fuck you" in her eyes. She up a multi-page list of addresses, hands it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This lists over fifty shit-value properties in industrial zones that nobody in their right mind would want to own -- stuff around chemical plants, factories. All are owned by Benson Clyde. Look at twenty-two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, not caring, scans down to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Joe's Lube-and-Drive Garage." Went out of business in '94. (looks up, irritated) Now why would Joe's extinct Lube- and-Shit Garage be of the slightest possible fucking interest to you, me, or anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tight, pissed) The garage, not so much. But the address. Look at the location.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks down at the list again...staring...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shitty garage in a shitty industrial park. Bordering it the other side of some fencing, are municipal train track Nick's car pulls up. He gets out. It's a ghost town here.

dialogues.speaker: BLUE
dialogues.text: He goes to the garage window -- glass thick with dirt. He wipes with his sleeve, but it doesn't help him see in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON ROLL-UP DOOR -- a CAR JACK jams in under the lip hear CRANKING and the door rises... Nick drops down, peering in. He squeezes under the door, up. Gloomy in here. He hits the door switch -- it RATTLES on its tracks, flooding the place with light... He looks around. Cobwebs. Dust. A CAR under a tarp on the hydraulic floor-lift. Old shelves and pallets of tools. R Grime. The crap of ages. He sighs, turns and walks out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and pauses. Something tickling his brain. Suddenly, a SHRIEKING COMMUTER TRAIN blasts by -- gone, dwindling. It was a bizarre, distinctive sound...like the Nick heard during his last phone call with Clyde. Nick stands frozen, pieces in his head tumbling and threa to fall into place. Something about the shape of that car under that tarp... He turns, staring at it. Goes back in, drawn to it -- it' long, distinctly old-school, with sharp boxy corners... He draws the tarp off -- finds a 1965 Lincoln Continental midnight-blue, in excellent condition. The last time he s it, it was parked in a carport at Benson Clyde's farmhous What's it doing here? More pieces falling into place. Nic leaves the garage again, walking out... CAMERA TRACKS HIM across the tarmac, and as we come aroun the corner of the building, we reveal: The County Correctional Annex is right there, a backwater corner of the prison not sixty feet away... Nick stares up at it -- a very curious location indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FAST CUTS: Nick searching...behind shelves...the toilet.. closets...the grimy little office... He stops. Looks at the car. There's a mechanic's pit belo that hydraulic lift. He goes to the control, hits "up"...

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC'S PIT
dialogues.text: Nick's face comes slowly into view as the hoist rises...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN BLACKNESS, WE HEAR: Boop-boop-boop...a cell being dial The line RINGING. A voice answering:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weary) Dunnigan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on cell) Do we finish this tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick? Jesus... (nervous glance around) Look. No hard feelings, but there is no "we." You're radioactive. I                      * can't even be seen talking to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who he's got on the outside. (that stops Dunnigan) I'll ask again. Do we finish this tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor Dunnigan looks tortured. He catches Garza's eye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TRAIN SHRIEKS through shot, revealing: The garage quiet in moonlight. The area deserted. Beat. T garage door rolls up on its tracks. Darkness within. A PAIR OF HEADLIGHTS kick on, blinding us. The Lincoln em moves off into the night as the door rolls down again. We hear SOFT STATIC from a police radio, and a voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All units. Subject vehicle is on the move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE WIDENS to reveal we're in an UNMARKED CAR -- Dunnig at the wheel, Nick beside him. Dunnigan's on the radio:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody maintain distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunnigan puts the car in gear, pulls out...

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: DRIFTING MAGICALLY THROUGH the downtown skyscrapers...neo lit rooftops...city lights reflecting off glass buildings AN FBI HELICOPTER drops into shot. CAMERA COMES AROUND, p the copter's reflection in the buildings we're passing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SKYSCRAPERS pass the lens below us... There's a midnight-blue Lincoln traveling the streets far below. It turns a corner, moving up a long boulevard. CAM PIVOTS around a skyscraper, following...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln cruising, cold reflections of street lamps ki off sheet metal, flowing along its body and windshield... WE START ZOOMING AND RACKING FOCUS to the unmarked cars t it in traffic....visually, it becomes a surreal dance of headlights and traffic signals...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POLICE COPTER joins the FBI copter in the air...both cr eerily against a kaleidoscopic wash of city lights...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maintain two thousand foot ceiling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Subject vehicle turning south off of Hudson...into an alley...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clicks hand-mic) Hang back...hang back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln pulls to a loading door. The door rises...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the Lincoln enters. It stops next to a LARGE CUBE with the logo: "Nomos Custodial Services." CAMERA PUSHES IN as the car door opens, feet step out... TILT UP to Clyde dressed in a custodial services uniform. slams the car door, gets in the van, fires up the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far below us, the van emerges from the same door, comes o of the alley and back onto the street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a white van...large cube type...think he switched vehicles... moving north again on Hudson...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five and six, stick with that building in case he's trying to cowboy us. All other units, stay with the van...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunnigan pulls out into traffic, resuming the tail...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have visual on van. Logo on side reads "Nomos Custodial Services."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell is he going?

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The glorious old building looms above us. TILT DOWN to re a red carpet event brewing -- LIMOS AND LUXURY CARS pulli up, GUESTS in expensive attire getting out... The NOMOS VAN STEALS THE FRAME as it drives past and turn go around the back of the building... A LIMO STEALS THE FRAME BACK as it pulls to the curb. The Mayor steps out, waving and smiling for FLASHING CAMERAS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Dunnigan drive past all the hoopla...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't suppose Nomos Custodial                    * has a service contract with City Hall, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Dunnigan's look of "oh shit"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON A CARD SCANNER as a card is swiped. THUNK -- the lock disengages. TILT UP to Clyde as he rolls a loaded custodial cart (with mops and trash barrel) inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUARD mans the security desk -- he glances up from a BA OF LIVE-FEED VIDEO MONITORS as Clyde rolls his cart in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Nomos! Ain't seen you around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted...had to get that vacation in. Visited my sister in the Keys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice. Good for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what's all that hoopla at the main entrance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayor's got a big fuckin' thing. Thousand dollar a plate whatever. They say the Governor might come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving on) I'll stay out of their way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls after him) They're up on six, avoid that floor. They got more security than God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far below: The entrance lit up with arriving cars and gue CAMERAS FLASHING... A HELICOPTER DRIFTS through the shot just below us in SLO MOTION, rotors thrumming eerily...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...while Clyde rides up. He stops at five, gets out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and rolls his cart up the hallway. MUFFLED MUSIC from floor above. He comes to a door, sorts his keys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and enters in darkness. Moving swiftly, he reaches int his trash barrel, pulls a gleaming STEEL BRIEFCASE from u the shredded papers -- he strides to the judge's dais, la the case atop it, turns and heads back to his cart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as a STREAM OF TACTICAL COPS stampede into the buildin and up the stairs. ANGLE FINDS Nick, Dunnigan, and Davies looming over the nervous security guard:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What floor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him to avoid six... (checking monitors) There...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a monitor: Clyde rolls his cart from the courtroom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the main courtroom on five.                     *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right below the ballroom. The Mayor's event.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early arrivals are coming up, entering the ballroom. The is crawling with SECRET-SERVICE TYPES in suits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde comes down the hallway B.G., rolling his cart... F.G., ANGLE FINDS tactical cops with machine guns pouring quietly up the stairs, taking up positions just around th corners, poised and tense. TIGHTEN IN as the TAC LEADER u a small mirror to peek around the corner and spot Clyde:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering on headset) Subject in sight. Do we take him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, Dunnigan and others are racing up the steps. Dunnig raises his radio to say yes, but:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Let him go. (off Dunnigan's look) We know where to find him. Let's get to that courtroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunnigan hesitates -- against every instinct in his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you know what the fuck you're doing. (clicks mic) Negative. We're letting him go. All units hang back. Repeat. We are letting the subject go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops trade surprised glances. The elevator DINGS. Cly gets on, the doors close. The cops swarm up the hallway..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This all happens fast: Bang -- the doors slam open. Nick a huge phalanx of cops and FBI in, weapons and flashlight beams stabbing in all directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They race to the judge's dais -- the steel case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch it! Could be motion sensitive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davies shoves his way to the front, grabs a small hand-he drill from one of his guys' tactical vests:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need light!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dozens of beams converge. Davies places the drill, goes t work on the case...grind, grind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have visual...suspect leaving the                   * building...different service exit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde exits a loading dock, gets in his van...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...grind, grind...the drill taps through. Davies yanks it feeds a fiber-optic tube into the hole, puts his eye to t eyepiece. He swivels the tube carefully, peering inside..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crap.                                                * (glances up)                                  * Explosives. Nasty ones.                              *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? C-4?                                           *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davies takes his eye from the eyepiece, looks at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C-4 is for girl scouts. This is malglinite. Take out the whole floor above us...maybe this entire corner of the building...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you open it? Disarm it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to eyepiece) No, we got tripwires. We open this lid, instant karma's gonna get us. (keeps scanning) Don't see a motion sensor. Trigger looks simple...dial a cell phone, incoming call arms the trigger -- trigger's set to count down from forty seconds, then boom. (off their looks) That call comes in, we have forty seconds to get as far away from this thing as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his men) Alert the mayor's security team.                     * Evacuate those people upstairs --                    * clear that ballroom, go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunnigan turns on him, instant shouting match:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? What the fuck are you talking about, this could go off any second!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't set it off until that room is full! People are still arriving, red carpet shit, that's at least another half hour!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not take that risk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Nick, no longer shouting, but intense and fast:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'm him, I've rigged cameras in that ballroom -- live video feed -- first sign of an evacuation, I trigger the bomb. (off their looks) We have to think ahead of this fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. Looks traded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Nick. What's the move?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde slams the van door, gets in the Lincoln. He pulls a handheld CLAMSHELL VIDEO MONITOR -- it shows a LIVE FEED people entering the ballroom, mingling as they arrive... Clyde smiles, starts the engine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor enters, waving to everybody, shaking hands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garage door rises. The Lincoln backs in, stops on the hydraulic lift. Clyde gets out, throws the tarp over it. Briefly checks his clamshell. Still plenty of time... He raises the lift a few feet, drops down and crawls unde the car into:

dialogues.speaker: THE MECHANIC'S PIT
dialogues.text: Duplicate controls. He hits the button and the car sinks atop us, settling to the floor, sealing us into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE
dialogues.text: Beat. A BRIGHT LIGHT turns on -- one of those gazillion candlepower flashlights. Clyde aims it and we see: A TUNNEL hewn into the wall of the mechanic's pit. Just l enough for Clyde to crawl into. He does...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand-dug, rough dirt held up by two-by-four bracing. A wh platform is the transport -- Clyde's on his back, pulling himself along by an overhead rope, hand over hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde emerges in the suffocating darkness of a sub-baseme laid into a foundation that dates back to the Civil War. crawls free, shining his light as rats scurry in shadows. He's on his hands and knees at first because the ceiling' low. He's finally able to rise, moving along at a crouch. ...and emerging into a proper sub-tunnel. Now able to wal normally, he navigates the tunnels and comes to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just below the solitary wing. Clyde has it rigged w all his needs: computer, spare cell phones, various kinds clothing, even a shelf lined with snacks. He quickly shrugs off his custodian's outfit, revealing h prison jumpsuit beneath. He gazes up a welded steel ladde (identical to four others in a row -- one for each cell). He checks his clamshell one last time, tweaking the bad reception with a relay -- ballroom looks full. He clicks his lamp and clamshell, sets them on a shelf... He goes up the ladder to a hatch in the ceiling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and enters through a swiveling portal concealed behind toilet. In deep darkness now, he pulls his cell phone, st inputting a number -- boop...boop...boop... And he freezes. Realizing... There's somebody in there with him...a silhouette sitting the floor by the door. The figure reaches out, pushes ope the outer door a bit. Faint light spills in, revealing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to talk. Guess who wasn't in his cell? Imagine my surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine mine. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful how you played us. Getting yourself tossed into solitary --                  * pre-rigged with exits from all five               * cells. Whichever one we put you in, you had your bases covered. (faint smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was such a bad-ass putting you down here. Turns out I was doing what you wanted. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how you play. Make the other guy think it's his idea. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came to talk, so talk. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been thinking. If I'd done things differently -- made different decisions from the start -- we wouldn't have gotten to this point. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it happened. And here we are. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we are. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your decisions put us here too. This mess is on both of us.                       * CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to hold hands? What's your point? NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't change decisions we've made. We can only account for decisions we make from here. I know what mine will be. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you? You gonna finish dialing that number, or what? Clyde hesitating, thumb hovering over the number pad. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I don't? What are you offering? NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You looking to deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm willing to listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, here's the deal. The deal is...there is no deal. (off Clyde's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you. No more deals with murderers. I'm sticking to that. That's my decision. It's what you                  * taught me. Strange as it sounds,                   * I'm grateful for the lesson.                       * Nick rises, steps out -- pauses, turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your turn. You make the right decision, I'll see what I can do for you. But the wrong decision is one you'll have to live with the rest of your life. The moment stretches. Clyde poised -- all down to this. I the end, he can't help himself: Boop-boop-boop -- hits se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too... Nick pushes the barred door shut...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...because like I said, it's a decision you'll have to live with the rest of your life. Which at this point I figure is... (glances at watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...another 35 seconds. ...and turns the key in the lock -- klatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check mate. Clyde hears a SOUND...like a phone ringing -- sort of clo but not -- muffled -- like the sound Cantrell heard... Clyde, realization dawning, thrusts his hand out and jerk the cot blanket up, revealing: The steel briefcase under his cot. He glances up to see: Nick gone. Clyde scrambles to his portal, yanks on the handle...

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE'S STAGING AREA, (UNDER THE CELLS)
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: The hatch handle rattles -- now padlocked shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FAST CUT: Dunnigan thrusts himself out of the tunnel, cop grabbing his arms, pulling him free...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick comes through the sally-port at a fast stride, throu another door, goes up the steps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde wheels around, frantic as a caged tiger -- he lunge the door, rattling the bars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...while Nick pounds faster and faster up staircase after staircase...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde -- enraged, bellowing -- picking up the steel brief swinging it hard against the bars, trying to batter throu And then stopping. A self-awareness returning. Perhaps it the Clyde that's been missing for years -- the sane one. Pause. He sets the briefcase down. Stands a moment. He sits down on the briefcase. Calm now. Pulls a SMALL PH from his breast pocket. Gazes at it. It's his wife and daughter. He stares at them a while. Tucks the photo back in his pocket. Nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well played.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOOOM! The DETONATION is staggering, instantly vaporizin Clyde and the cell he's in...

dialogues.speaker: SOLITARY WING
dialogues.text: ...BLOWING the bars right out of the stone on a WALL OF F that overwhelms the lens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...FLAME HURTLING with express-train force...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and BLASTING TONS OF BRICK AND MORTAR skyward. Nick enters the shot as WE DOLLY BACK WITH HIM, walking a from the building going to dust and rubble B.G. CAMERA PANS HIM AROUND, now following him, as he approach Davies standing with Iger. Iger is staring, agog:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.                                                 * (beat)                                          * Thank God that wing was empty.                         *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car arriving behind them: Dunnigan getting out, approac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I explain this to the city?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think the Mayor will have your back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick approaches, comes abreast of them. Looks are traded with Dunnigan and Davies. Relief. Fellow A touch of sadness. Words aren't needed here. Nick keeps walking, pulls his cell phone, starts dialing. Dunnigan smiles. He knows exactly where Nick's going...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONG LENS: Nick sitting...waiting... An ARRIVING TRAIN moves massively into the shot, pulling the station... Nick rises. A SQUEAL OF BRAKES, steel on steel... Nick engulfed in a crowd of arriving passengers, people g off, swirling and jostling all around him, wiping frame.. ...only two faces he wants to see... ...and there they are... He sweeps his family into his arms. The final moments of movie are all about faces and joy... ...and CREDITS BEGIN as we
